texts.en: Khadija lives in Mombasa Kenya. She is a food vendor in town. She doesn't have a permanent stall where she serves her customers. She has been running this business for three years now and the business is doing great. She heard of Milango through her friends and she decided to join so that she could access credit to expand her business operations. She now seeks a loan to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and beans for her business. Her ambition is that she will be able to open a stable food cafe in the near future. The major challenge for her in the business is the high price of food stuff. Khadija is 45 years of age and she is married and had been blessed with one child. The extra income that she will earn will allow her to have better living standards in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 43 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are in school.

Virgilia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Virgilia requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Virgilia has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Virgilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a 36 year-old father of two from Embu, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Monica who helps him in farming. He also operates a public service vehicle, a business which supplements his income. He earns a monthly income of KES 28,000 which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his second loan term with KADET. With the loan he has applied from KADET, he will be able to purchase animal feed and expand the animals shed. Additional income created will allow him improve the standard of living for his family. In the future, John would like to build a permanent store to keep his cereals and other grains. 

He hopes to save money to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and expand the animals shed

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 32-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she can generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anastacio Jr.

texts.en:
Anastacio Jr. is farmer who lives in Tungawan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married and has two children. 

Farming has been his main source of income for ten years by planting and harvesting corn, bananas and coconuts. 

In 2012, he joined Gata Daku MPC to micro finance services.  He seeks a loan to cover the cost of land preparation for crop production. 

Anastacio Jr. hopes to grow an abundant harvest in order to earn more income to improve the living situation of the family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of land preparation for crop production.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 25 years old married woman; she is running a milk sales business (husband in photo). She started her business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner in their family. 

With the passage of time, her sales and income increased.  Now she has two buffaloes and one cow.  This has all happened due to her courage and determination.  Because of her work, she is respected in her home.  She helps her husband in all family and financial matters. 

Tahira has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000/-to purchase another buffalo.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 43 year old single mother of two from Mwingi.  She earns a living by operating a retail shop.  

Esther has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to a lack of investment capital.  Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand.  Her goal is to fully stock her store in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. 

Esther is requesting a loan from KADET LTD to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.  With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, Esther will be able to improve the living conditions for her family and support the education of her two children. 

In the future, Esther plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a larger wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita came from a small village around the town of Cilacap, which still has a quiet atmosphere and many trees,  the village Penggalang, Adipala. Because Adipala is near the coastal areas, Nita has a dream to work in ports or work on a ship. Nita is currently a candidate in the Nusantara Maritime Academy, where she will take a Nautical program. 

Nita’s parents work in a kiosk selling chicken noodles and meatballs on the side of the road, and are open from morning till evening. Their income is not fixed, but depends on the number of visitors. If there is inclement weather, rain for example, the kiosk is deserted and no one is buying. Nita wants to help ease the burden of her parents, with an education loan from Kiva, 

Nita ventured to follow this program. She wants to finish school and get a job quickly in a shipping company. Nita thanks  Kiva lenders, with these loans that can help her study for three years.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Feftiyan

texts.en:
Feftiyan is a prospective student who studies management, commerce and harbor administration in the Nusantara Maritime Academy. She wants to be a reliable and professional employees at a large harbor office. Her parents are Chicken Noodle sellers in Jakarta. Her parents tried to make every effort to help Feftiyan achieve her goals, despite having to part with their child. 

Feftiyan is currently living with her grandparents. Her parents  come back from Jakarta every two months. With these conditions, Feftiyan hopes to get a loan from Kiva, to help finance her studies, and ease the burden of her parents. Feftiyan is very grateful to lenders because they will allow her to continue her studies, though they cannot personally know each other.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 24 years lady who has run a beauty parlor for the past three years.  She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  

She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough money to contribute to her family's income.

Bushra has applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 through the Kashf Foundation to purchase hair and skin care products and creams for bleaching and whitening.  

She is very experienced in her business and confident that her salon will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair and skin care products and creams for bleaching and whitening.

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en:
Ramzan is a 48 year-old married, vigorous lady.  She has been manufacturing carpets for the past ten years to contribute in the family income. 

She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. To improvement her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. 

Ramzan hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell beauty products business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Zenaida has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela, age 42, is a married woman. For many years, she has been successfully running a business of milk sales. She has one buffalo which she uses for milk, selling to the people of her community.  Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She is a loving mother of five children. Her husband works in a factory with a low salary income, and that is why Jameela is motivated to provide them with good quality food, education and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. This is her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through their support. 

Now she has requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Darine

texts.en:
Darine is a 28 year-old single lady who finished her technical school to work to make her dream to come true.  She studied photography, which started as a hobby.  She works hard to enhance her skills and work every day.

Darine has her own photography studio, which she established in 2004.  She has more than eight years of experience.

Darine is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing her business.  She is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new updated camera that will provide her with higher quality images and better features.  Darine will also will buy more picture frames  This will help her offer even better services to her customers.

Darine also hopes to keep improving her business by recruiting someone to help her cover more than one event at a time.

loans.use: to buy a new updated camera and picture frames.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is Sabina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the materials needed in making furniture. Her income from the loan helped in the education of her children a well as in their everyday expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw materials like bamboo, burnish and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sabina dreams to be more successful in her business and have more customers. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like bamboo, burnish and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Bolivar 1 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BOLIVAR 1”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de pulpería, venta de pantalones, tejido de mantas de vicuña, venta de fruta, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Antonia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió al observar la carencia de este servicio en su zona y decidió solicitar un crédito en Pro Mujer, desde esa fecha trabaja con esta forma de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, conservas) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The community association “BOLIVAR 1”  will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and directed by an executive board on which Señora Antonia is the President. The community association's members run various businesses, including a grocery store, a clothing store, blanket weaving, fruit selling and clothes selling. 

The loan they receive will benefit small microentrepreneurs including Señora Antonia. She explains that that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago, on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Today, she has a neighborhood store. She says that she began this business when she observed that her area lacked this service, and decided to request a loan from Pro Mujer. Since then, she has worked in this business.
 
She will use the loan she will now obtain to increase her capital (buying rice, sugar, oil and preserves) from distributors in the City of El Alto. She will then sell them in her store. This work enables her to generate resources to maintain her home as much as possible, as she is single and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and preserves.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 55-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk sales with her husband for 5 years. She has two cows in milk and one calf. She milks the cows and then sells their milk to her neighbors, along with butter and yogurt that she makes from the milk. She has become famous by providing good quality milk and has retained regular customers. She has improved her business to meet with the growing demands of her family. 

For the further improvement in the business she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase one more cow. In this way she would be able to generate more revenue through her business by increasing her production capacity of milk.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman lives in the town of Kutaisi. He is 28 years old, married, and has a 4-year-old daughter. The only source of income for the family is a small salary (approximately $180 per month) earned by Nariman working as an operator for a private company. As the existing income is not enough to cover everyday expenses, Nariman decided to purchase a car and start a taxi business to get additional revenue in order to ensure that his family members have better living conditions. 

Nariman’s loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to the country vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Nariman will buy a secondhand car and serve local people as a taxi driver during his free time. The income of the family will increase and, in case of need, they will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase a car for starting a taxi business.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 33-year-old lady who has enjoyed doing hand embroidery for many years. She very well knows the art of embroidery with pearls and stones. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  

But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. She wants to expand her business and requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy threads, stones, pearls and glittering material in various colors to complete the orders of her customers on time. 

She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to maximize her profit from this business and provide a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy threads, stones, pearls and glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is 22 years old and from Gaza. He has owned a barbershop since 2010 and has one employee. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a new haircutting chair, some furniture, and new cutting materials for his barbershop. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the scope of his work and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a new haircutting chair, some furniture, and new cutting materials

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has a dairy shop in Kangundo town that she has been running for the last three years. She also rears dairy cattle and this has enabled her to get more milk to sell. She is 41 years old and married with three children.

This will be her second loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of milk to sell in her dairy shop. She will also use the loan amount to buy feed for her dairy cattle. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to open more dairy shops and become successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of milk to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 64-year-old business lady. She is a married mother of five. 

She has been selling scrap metal for the past five years successfully with a monthly income of KES 5,000. She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd. after she was introduced by an existing client. 

She plans to purchase more scrap metals. She will use the anticipated profits to meet her family’s basic needs. 

Her hopes and dreams are to see all her children living a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap metals.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra es una joven de veintidós (22) años de edad, que reside en la ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del Atlántico; vive con su conyugue y dos hijos, un niño de un (1) año, y una (1) niña de tres (3) años. Su actividad de negocio es la comercialización de ropa y calzado para damas y caballeros, los cuales los vende a amigos, familiares, vecinos, compañeros de estudio; quienes le compran a crédito. Su conyugue también le ayuda vendiéndole en casinos. El negocio lo inició desde hace dos (2) años, por intermedio de la suegra, que reside en el vecino país de Venezuela; ella le envía la ropa y el calzado que esté a la moda, satisfaciendo los gustos de su clientela. Todos los días de lunes a domingo, de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m., está trabajando en función de su negocio, ofreciendo y cobrando. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de camisueter, camisetas, jeans, y calzado deportivo para damas y caballeros. Tiene como meta ampliar su surtido para hacer crecer el negocio, y además, en futuro no muy lejano tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a young woman, 22 years old, who lives in the city of Barranquilla in the department of Atlántico.  She lives with her spouse and her two children, a one-year-old boy and a three-year-old girl.  Her business activity is the selling of clothing and footwear for ladies and gentlemen, which she sells to friends, relatives, neighbors and fellow students, who buy from her on credit.  Her spouse also helps her by selling in casinos.  She started the business two years ago by means of her mother-in-law who lives in the neighboring country of Venezuela.  She sends her the clothing and footwear that are in fashion, satisfying the tastes of her customers.  Every day from Monday to Sunday, from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., she is working, offering and charging, which are the tasks of her business.

This is her first Kiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will apply to the purchase of polo shirts, t-shirts, jeans and sports shoes for ladies and gentlemen.  She has as her goal to expand her selection to make her business grow and also, in the not-too-distant future, to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, t-shirts, jeans and sports shoes for ladies and gentlemen.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, desde hace 35 años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maíz y frijol cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que son los que muestra la fotografía,  con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc. pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Orlando is 53 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and child. For 35 years, he has worked in agriculture which is his main source of income. He grows maize and beans. When his harvest is ready he stores it in barns like the one in the photograph. With the earnings he makes from his crops he is able to pay some household bills. 

He wants to buy the inputs he needs for his crops such as compost, fertiliser, seeds and herbicides, but he doesn't have enough money to make this investment, so he has decided to request a loan. This is the only way he can continue to farm. Like any other labourer, he places his trust in agriculture, as he has no other source of income and wants to succeed doing the best he can with his crops. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest which will allow him to continue supporting his family and pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertiliser, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Godlief

texts.en:
Godlief a prospective student and is 23 years old. He moved from the old campus, as there is no money to continue his studies. His father works as a laborer whose income is not fixed. Income from agriculture is not sufficient, because it depends on the weather in the region. His parents want their children to go to school so that they have a happy future. 

Thanks to his parents' encouragement, Godlief  is determined to study at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, because of his ideals. Godlief wants to work in a large port in Indonesia. He is taking the program management, commerce and harbor administration course. 

Due to economic conditions the parents' income is not fixed, so Godlief volunteered to follow the Student Loan from Kiva, in order to ease the burden on his parents and so he could continue his studies. Godlief is very grateful to the lenders from around the world who would help him in his studies, although they cannot get to know him personally.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of selling milk for many years with her husband. She has three buffaloes in milk, and she sells their milk to many of her neighbors. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. She is a mother of four children, one of her sons works in a sports manufacturing factory to support his family. They need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. 

Shahnaz requested for a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy one more buffalo. In this way she would be able to increase her sales which ultimately helps in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz, age 37, is a married woman and lives with her husband and three children. She works hard to provide for her family and stitches clothes to contribute to her family income. She very well knows the methods of stitching clothes according to fashion. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

In order to expand her business she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. She is in her second loan cycle with good loan history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 41-year-old woman. She is a loving mother of two children. Her husband is laborer whose income is insufficient for their family expenditures. This compelled her to initiate her own business of stitching clothes to contribute to the family income. She is expert in stitching stylish dresses according to her customers’ demand. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 35,000. 

Shameem intends to use this loan amount to purchase more reels of thread, along with packs of buttons and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand without delay. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Shameem hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, along with packs of buttons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wazir

texts.en:
Wazir, age 44, is a vigorous married lady. She has been successfully running a business of clothing sales for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the market and prepares fancy dresses by doing embroidery with pearls, stones and sequins. She sells her fancy dresses to the people of her community and also in the market at reasonable prices. She has become famous by providing good quality embroidery dresses and earns enough to live a decent life. 

She wants to expand her business and requested for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs with more spools of thread, stones and pearls to increase her sales. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to maximize her profit from this business and provide a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs with more spools of thread, stones and pearls.

loans.name: Afifa

texts.en:
Afifa is a 29-year-old married mother of four children, and she works hard with her husband to provide them with the best education and living conditions.

Afifa started her small sized wholesale trade a year ago. She sells sunglasses, accessories and Brazilian gold. Her business is developing gradually, and she is working hard to keep it up-to-date to attract more customers. Today Afifa is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise capital with a new released collection.

Her business is located at home. As for the future, she will work hard to move it to a bigger shop, and she is willing to register a new company specializing in importing and selling Brazilian gold to more people.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise capital with a new released collection.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bales of second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ayesh

texts.en:
Ayesh is 30 years old and lives in Ramallah. He is married and has one child.

He has owned a barbershop since the year 2000 and has one employee.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy chairs and do some decorations for the barbershop.

He hopes that this loan will help increase his customers and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy chairs and do some decorations for the barbershop.

loans.name: Marcio

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcio es de la ciudad de Pilar, quien trabaja y lucha por poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan por medio de la despensa que tiene. El es casado y tiene hijos, y cuenta que es por ellos que siempre se esfuerza, para que nos les falte nada.
Su esposa es quien siempre lo ayuda en todo lo que hace, es por eso que en la foto aparece con ella y con su hija. Hoy Marcio pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos, como ser bebidas, gaseosas comestibles, lácteos y demás, ya que son los que mas salida tienen y quiere poder ofrecer a sus clientes todo lo que le piden. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Marcio is from the city of Pilar.  He works and struggles to be able to give his family what they need with the general store he has.  He is married and has children and says that he works for them so that they do not lack anything.  His wife always helps him in everything he does, so he appears in the photo with her and their daughter.  

Marcio is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as drinks, sodas, food items, dairy products, and more.  These items are the most popular and he wants to be able to offer his customers everything they request.  He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving since it will be a great help.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, sodas, food items, dairy products, and other items.

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en:
Sarwar is a 59-year-old married woman; she has been doing a business of crockery sales for a period of about two years. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets and bowls, etc. Her husband also assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000. In this way she would be able to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and plates in various sizes and designs. She is on her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and plates in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida, age 33, is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with the support of her husband for the past three years. Her husband assists her by purchasing her stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Sajida wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and oil to meet the increasing demand in her store. She aspires to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and oil.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 33-year-old married woman. She is happily running a business of animal sales and purchases with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. 

Shehnaz has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 47-year-old married woman. She works hard to provide a better lifestyle for her family by running a small general store for many years with her husband. The man shown in the picture is her husband. He purchases a stock of goods from the market, and he has maintained many contacts over the years. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to have a decent life. 

Currently, Shahnaz requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy packs of sugar, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at their store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of sugar, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Karen Maria

texts.es: Karen es una joven de escasos dieciocho (18) años de edad, que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del Atlántico. Reside con sus padres en esta ciudad, conocida nacionalmente también como “la arenosa”. Su actividad de negocio es la compra y venta de productos como perfumes, desodorantes, colonias, cosméticos, cremas de manos y cuerpo, ropa y calzado para damas y caballeros. Estos productos los adquiere por pedidos de revistas de catalogos, y también los trae de la ciudad de Medellin , del departamento de Antioquia, Colombia. Compra de contado y a crédito. Vende también de contado y a crédito, a vecinos, amigos y familiares. Desde hace un (1) año inició este negocio, el cual lo aprendió desde niña, ayudando a su tía y a su mamá que también se dedican a este tipo de negocios. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de cosméticos, perfumes, ropas y calzado que le han pedido sus clientes. Con estas inversiones espera seguir aumentando su capital, darles mas plazo a sus clientes, aumentar su ayuda a sus padres,y poder culminar sus estudios técnicos.
texts.en:
Karen is a young woman, just 18 years old, who lives in the city of Barranquilla in the department of Atlántico.  She lives with her parents in this city, also known nationally as “la arenosa” (the Sandy City).  Her business activity is the buying and selling of products like perfumes, deodorants, colognes, cosmetics, hand and body creams, clothes and shoes for ladies and gentlemen.  She acquires these products by orders from catalogue magazines and she also brings them from the city of Medellín, of the department of Antioquia, Colombia.  She buys with cash and on credit.  She also sells for cash and on credit, to neighbors, friends and relatives.  She started this business one year ago, which she learned as a girl, helping her aunt and her mother who also made a living at this type of business.  

This is her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will apply to the purchase of cosmetics, perfumes, clothing and shoes that her customers have ordered from her.  With this investment she hopes to continue to increase her capital, give more time to her customers, increase her help to her parents and to be able to complete her technical studies.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, clothes and shoes that her customers have ordered.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a mother of three from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She is married to David who is also a farmer; she earns a monthly income of KES 18,000 which she uses to support her family. This marks her first loan with KADET after she was introduced by an existing KADET client. 

With the loan she has applied for from KADET LTD, she will be able to purchase poultry feed and purchase one-day-old chicks for rearing. Additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family. In the future, Mary would like to build a permanent store to keep her farm produce in. 

She hopes to save money to educate her children to the college level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and purchase one-day-old chicks to rear

loans.name: Rev Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married lady, age 45 years old. She supports 6 of her children, who are between 23 and 4 years old. She owns a grinding machine in the Eldama/Ravine location and has been in operation for over a period of 10 years earning an income of about Kes 12,000 a month.

She is now servicing her 1st loan of Kes 30,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase a stock of dry maize for grinding and selling to her customers. The profits she earns will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of dry maize for grinding and then selling to her customers.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet, a 57-year-old married business lady in Thika, earns her living by operating a private medical clinic. She has been operating the clinic for the past 21 years and earns a monthly income of about KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD in order to buy building materials to expand the structure of her clinic, and she will use the remaining amount to purchase more drugs. With the additional income, she will reinvest in the business. 

She hopes to expand her clinic into a hospital and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to expand the structure of her clinic and use the remaining amount to purchase more drugs.

loans.name: Lyvia

texts.en:
Lyvia is 33 years old, has one child, age 7, and supports two members of her family. 

She sells second-hand clothes to earn her daily living. She has been in the business for five years, earning an income of KES 20,000.

She is servicing her third loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd. and wishes to use this amount to pay school fees for her child. 

The profits she earns will be used to expand her business and purchase more stock of clothes for resale.

Her dream is to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials such as soles, leather, glue, thread, etc.

loans.name: Las Merceditas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Merceditas , está en su ciclo  8° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo que gracias a su esfuerzo y su sacrificio están mejorando sus vidas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de conocer íntegramente a las señoras y tener una visión integra de sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Secundina  quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel rojo, es decir con ingresos insuficientes. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que vende sábanas, colchas,s fundas y venta de productos argentinos también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superarse cada día.
Secundina solicita de este crédito para la compra de sábanas, colchas, fundas, lo cual  la ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Las Merceditas group is in its eighth cycle of the women's committee programme. It is a group that, thanks to its efforts and sacrifice, is improving the lives of its members. They are doing a survey on the eradication of poverty, as a way of getting to know the women thoroughly and getting a complete vision of their lives.

One of the member is Secundina, who had a red level of poverty in her last survey. This means she has insufficient resources. Among the work she does is selling bedsheets, quilts and covers. She also sells products from Argentina. It's also important to highlight the work of the assessors, who continuously follow up on the training and verifications required, and at the same time motivate the women to fight to succeed every day.

Secundina is requesting this loan to buy sheets, quilts and covers, which will help her to cement her business plan, in turn helping her to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy sheets, quilts and covers.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Félix es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene un Copetín en su casa, en el que trabaja hace más de 10 años. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, que siempre gusta de todo lo que el ofrece.
Él es muy emprendedor, a quien gusta poder ayudar a las demás personas. Su principal sueño es poder agrandar su local, y de esa forma poder ofrecer una mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas en general, como ser jugos, gaseosas, cervezas y demás, ya que quiere surtirse y poder cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes de esa forma.
texts.en:
Félix is from the city of Santaní.  He has a bar in his home where he has worked for more than 10 years.  He says he has many customers who always like what he is offering.  He is very enterprising and likes to be able to help other people.  His dream is to expand his bar and be able to offer a more comfort to his customers.  

He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of beverages such as juice, soda, beer, and others since he wants to stock his store and be able to fulfill his customers' orders.

loans.use: to purchase beverages such as juice, soda, beer, and others.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 46-year-old married woman who is shown in the photo with her husband and a son. 

Shamim has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase with her husband for the past four years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event of Muslims). She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.

To help them to continue operations of their business, Shamim requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another baby cow. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another baby cow.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 47 years old. He lives in the small village of the District with his wife and two children. Merab requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides that, they have a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of fruit and vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested products with the cheese at local markets.  It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Merab requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Merab has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Merab will purchase a stock of groceries and open a grocery shop. When the shop is opened, the family will have chance to generate income and make it stable. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries and open a shop

loans.name: Peguaho Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Peguaho está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 16 mujeres se encuentran en el nivel verde, es decir con ingresos buenos, pero ellas deben de seguir trabajando y manteniendo esos ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gumercinda, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel amarillo, es decir con ingresos medios. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas y de estación, en lo cual le esta yendo muy bien, ya que están mejorando sus ventas. Es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas para la venta, como ser bananas, manzanas, peras, piña y demás. Agradece por esta gran oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
The Peguaho group is in their 10th cycle with the women's committee program where they all work and help each other to succeed.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey.  Sixteen women are at the green level, meaning they have good income but they need to continue working to maintain their income.  

One of the group members is Gumercinda, who was at the yellow level of poverty during the last survey, meaning she has middling income.  Through her effort, continued work, and application of important behaviors of successful women, she is improving her poverty situation.  She works selling fresh and seasonal fruit.  It is going very well since she is improving her sales.  She is a hardworking person who fights to succeed.

She is requesting this loan to purchase fruit to sell such as bananas, apples, pears, pineapple, and others.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона умная и добродушная девушка. Ей 24 года. Она не замужем и живет в родительском доме. Фарзона работает в детском садике своего района более 5 лет. Она является воспитательницей. Фарзона любит маленьких детей и хорошо знает их психологию и поэтому ей легко справляться с работой. Фарзона планирует усовершенствовать свое знание и поднять квалификацию. С такой целью она поступила в университет. Фарзона так как является умной девушкой, с легкостью будет справляться с учебой и работой. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Farzona is a smart and good-natured girl. She is 24 years old. She is not married and lives at home with her parents. Farzona has worked in her region's childcare center for over five years. She is a teacher. Farzona likes small children and understands their psychology well. As a result, she does well at her job.

Farzona plans to improve her education and raise her qualifications. To do so, she has enrolled in a university. Farzona is a smart girl, and would easily manage her studies along with her job. She is applying for a loan of 1,500 somoni to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 24 years old and lives in Gaza.

He has owned an aluminum workshop since 2012 in which he manufactures and sells doors, windows and aluminum for kitchens.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an aluminum saw, install shelves, and purchase an air compressor for his aluminum workshop.

Through this loan he will be able to increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy an aluminum saw, install shelves, and purchase an air compressor for his aluminum workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes for her husband's shoe sales business.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer is a 29-year-old single man who has had an entertainment shop since 2005. He also has a separate café, specializing in hookahs and juices, to satisfy customers’ needs. Most of his customers are teenagers and young people who want to spend part of their time in a joyful environment. Amer is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to support his hookah and juice business departments, especially during this hot summer season. This loan and the income it produces will surely reflect positively on his socioeconomic situation. He will make sure to start building his dream house with the revenues he's going to acquire, and to save for useful expenditures. Amer hopes to keep on developing his business and pleasing his customers as much as he can, to expand his working place in the near future.

loans.use: to support his hookah and juice business departments.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El señor Hector tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, el mismo se dedica al macate (venta ambulante) hace varios años, tiene todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y demás.
Se pudo ir haciendo de una buena clientela gracias a la variedad de prendas que siempre ofrece a sus clientes. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por mejorar día a día.
solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas y calzados para la venta, con lo que podrá surtirse y seguir haciendo sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Hector is 41 years old, and lives in the city of Itá. He has made a living selling on the street for several years. He sells all types of products, such as clothing, shoes, household items and other goods.

He has been able to build up a good client base thanks to the variety of products he always offers to his customers. He is a very hardworking, enterprising individual, who fights to succeed every day.

He is requesting this loan to invest in buying clothing and shoes to sell, to restock and continue selling his goods. He is grateful for this opportunity he is being given.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Librada está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas esta poniendo todo de si para ir creciendo y mejorando. Ellas estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y de esa forma poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariela quien es una persona muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y también se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace. Gracias a su trabajo y a que siempre da todo de si es que puede ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que estamos en la época invernal y quiere poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Santa Librada group is in their fourth cycle with the women's committee program where each woman is giving it her all to grow and improve.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey so that they can understand each woman's situation.

One of the members is Mariela, who is a hardworking person.  She works selling all types of clothing and also sells food that she prepares.  Thanks to the work that she gives her all to, she is able to help her family.

Mariela is requesting this loan to purchase winter clothing since it is the winter season and she wants to be able to offer her customers a good variety.  This will help her firm up her plan for her business which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fraternidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Fraternidad es de la Ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer como cada una de ellas están en los diferentes ámbitos de su vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Benita, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace. Comenta que gracias a que sus comestibles son muy aceptadas, es que ella ya se hizo de muy buena clientela, y eso le va ayudando a tener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Hoy la Sra. Benita solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su elaboración y venta de comidas, como ser carne, pollo, jamón, queso, condimentos y demás insumos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Fraternidad group is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. They are doing a survey on the eradication of poverty to get an idea of where each of them stands in the different areas of their life. 
One of the members is Benita, who makes a living selling food she makes. She says that thanks to the fact that people enjoy her food, she has built up a good customer base, and this is helping her to earn more to help her family.
Today, Benita is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to make and sell food, such as meat,chicken, ham, condiments and other items. This will help her to cement her business plan and boost her earnings.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, ham, condiments and other ingredients.

loans.name: Yvette Assiba's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Yvette Assiba est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Yvette Assiba est veuve et mère de trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et tous à sa charge. Yvette Assiba n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Yvette Assiba vit seule avec ses enfants. Yvette Assiba assure seule les charges de ses enfants. C'est pour cette raison que Yvette Assiba vend des produits divers( riz, sucre, savon etc.) par la méthode de distribution depuis treize ans. Yvette Assiba s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Yvette Assiba ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, désire obtenir un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Yvette Assiba, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. This is the first time this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their businesses. Yvette Assiba is a widow and the mother of three children, not all in school, but all in her care. 

Yvette Assiba did not go to school. She lives alone with her children and ensures by herself that their expenses are covered. For this reason, she has been selling a variety of goods (rice, sugar, soap, etc.) via the distribution system for thirteen years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of increasing her stock of products and responding further to the demands of her customers, Yvette Assiba together with the other members of her group would like to obtain a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods (rice, sugar, soap, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Félicienne's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Félicienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Félicienne est âgée de 61 ans. Félicienne est mariée avec un certain Barnabé. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés. Mais aucun enfant n'est plus à sa charge. Félicienne vit avec son mari. Depuis près de trente ans, Félicienne vend des sacs de charbon de bois à son domicile. Félicienne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour élargir son activité, Félicienne ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood.  It is the first time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to raise its level of activity.

Félicienne, the group's representative, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. She is 61 years old and married to a man named Barnabé. They have five children who no longer are their dependents, although some of them are still in school.  Félicienne lives with her husband. 

She has been selling bags of charcoal, from home, for close to thirty years.  She buys her merchandise at a market located in Benin.

Eager to satisfy the needs of her customers and expand her activity, she is requesting a loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 54-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Kasyoka

texts.en:
Kasyoka, a 40-year-old single mother of three from Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a small retail shop. She has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to the lack of investment capital. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her store in order to attract more customers and increase her profits.

She is requesting a loan from KADET LTD in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will be able to improve living conditions for her family and support the education of her three children. 

In the future, Kasyoka plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a larger wholesale store.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old and married to Agnes, and they have two children. 

He is a farmer from Olkalau who earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy a cow. He paid his previous loans on time.

With the anticipated profit, he hopes to pay back the loan and pay school fees.

He hopes to buy more cows in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Hasna Group

texts.en: This group is called Hasna. It consists of four women who live in Aden, Yemen. All of them are family people and hard-working. They took out a loan of 120,000 YER. Hasna is 56 years old, a married woman who has five children. She has pledged to move ahead in life and improve her quality of life. She has a small house. She went to a lot of effort, and had to save money with her family, to set up her house. She is aiming to complete her house. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy building materials for the maintenance of her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the maintenance of her house.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a woman of forty-one years, married to Peter and a mother of two lovely children. She makes handbags using beads and also keeps poultry; she has been in these businesses for eight years now and gets a  monthly income of one hundred thousand shillings.

This will be Margaret's sixth loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy materials like beads and thread to help with her art work. In future she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy beads for her art work

loans.name: Sharlet

texts.en: Sharlet is 29 years old, married and a mother of one child. She operates a salon in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last three years. She earns a monthly profit of 9,254 KES. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of 20,000 KES. Sharlet intends to use the loan to add to the inventory of hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes needed for her business. She will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her child. In the future, Sharlet hopes to grow her salon and also intends to open up a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: To purchase hair products such as weaves, wigs and hair dyes

loans.name: Adyanath Self Help Group

texts.en:
Adyanath Self Help Group is a group consisting of nine members of whom all are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. Few years back they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they could provide the basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Mrs. Nilima who was selected as their president. Nilima is a 46-year-old lady living with her husband. The lady siting to the extreme right wearing a green saree is Nilima. Her husband works as a labourer in a factory situated near her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. 

Nilima likes the fact that she can cater for the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which reason she has requested a loan to utilize it in purchasing the items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

Nilima, along with her group members, has requested a loan amount of 135,000 INR.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.name: Vano

texts.en: Vano is 43 years old, divorced, and lives with his father in a small village in Khoni district. Vano’s father is a pensioner who helps him to run a small-scale dairy farm, with a milk cow. The family sells the milk at the local market. Besides this, Vano owns a tractor and serves local farmers in return for service fees. According to a government evaluation, the family belongs to “vulnerable poor” category, and they receive a small amount of monthly assistance, approximately $32 a month. As the income is not enough for food and every-day expenses, Vano decided to set up a workshop to generate an income. He used to work as a joiner, and he has rich experience in this field. With the credit, Vano will buy a joiner’s desk and all the other necessary equipment to start the workshop. He will work on special orders to serve local people. This start-up credit will be a great help for the family to increase their monthly income and improve their living conditions. Vano thanks all Kiva lenders in advance.

loans.use: to establish a joiner's workshop.

loans.name: Jovenes Alegres Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Jóvenes Alegres  está en su décimo segundo del programa de comité de jóvenes, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante y de esa forma poder fomentar el compañerismo.
Noelia es la presidenta de este grupo, ella se esta esforzando día a día para poder mejorar su vida y ayudar a su familia. Motiva siempre a sus compañeras en cada ciclo y de esa forma que cada una vaya creciendo en su emprendimiento. Ella por su parte se dedica a la peluquería, tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en donde atiende a sus clientes. Es una persona muy sacrificada.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su salón de belleza, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras, y demás insumos varios que pueda necesitar en su salón. Agradece por esta oportunidad de ir mejorando su vida y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The Jóvenes Alegres group is in their 10th cycle with the youth committee program.  They all promised to work and help each other to succeed, which will allow them to promote fellowship.  

Noelia is the president of the group.  She is making an effort every day to be able to improve her life and help her family.  She always motivates the other group members each cycle so that each one can grow their businesses.  She works as a hairdresser and has a small beauty salon where she sees her customers.  She is a person who makes sacrifices.

She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies for her beauty salon including hair dyes, shampoo, conditioner, scissors, and other items that she needs.  She is grateful for this opportunity to continue to improve her life and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair dye, shampoo, conditioner, scissors, and other supplies.

loans.name: Egbelowadjou Group

texts.fr: EGBELOWADJOU est un groupe constitué de six personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Gisèle. Les membres de ce groupe habitent le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Gisèle est âgée de 54 ans et est une veuve. Gisèle est mère de six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à sa charge. Gisèle vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différents besoins. Gisèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille, Gisèle vend des tissus et divers autres produits depuis une vingtaine d'année par la méthode de distribution. Gisèle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Gisèle et aux autres membres du groupe EGBELOWADJOU, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
EGBELOWADJOU is a group composed of six persons. The group's representative (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is named Gisèle. The group members live in the same district. With the goal of increasing its working capital, this group is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Gisèle is 54 years old, a widow, and the mother of six children, not all in school with one in her care. Gisèle lives alone with her children and is by herself in ensuring their different needs are covered.

Gisèle did not go to school. To cope with family needs, she has been selling cloth and a variety of other products for about twenty years via the distribution method. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. This loan will certainly enable Gisèle and the other members of the group EGBELOWADJOU to boost their businesses and to grow their customer base. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, etc. to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 57 years old and has two children, with her husband James. They live in Teshie.  Florence has owned a grocery store for the past eight years, and this is her family's main source of income. When she started her business, she used the small amount of money that she had saved to buy rice, sugar, milk, and other provisions to sell and generate profits. She currently has more products. She is very happy with her business because, with time, it has become a favorite and well-known neighborhood store. Florence is standing on the left hand side of the photograph and, with her, is her group leader Florence. One of her long-term goals is to build her home with better materials and improve her family life. This is her first Kiva loan and her seventh loan from ID-Ghana. She promises to make her payments on time. She applied for a loan of GHS 2,500 to buy one bag of rice, one bag of sugar, and boxes of milk, soap and cereal to sell, because these products are in high demand.

loans.use: to buy one bag of rice, one bag of sugar, and boxes of  milk, soap and cereal to sell, because these products are in high demand.

loans.name: Zoia

texts.en: Zoia is a 58-year-old married woman from the Dusheti district. She lives with her husband and son. Her son is the only person in the family who is working; he works as a guitar teacher and receives a small monthly income. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps the inhabitants to make a living. So Zoia decided to start own business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from their borrowers. Zoia’s credit applications were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the Startup Program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $1000, she will buy  a stock of groceries. She has a commercial space, where she is going to open a shop. As the stock of groceries is purchased, she will be able to work in her shop and increase the family income. The Startup credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased, thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries and open a shop.

loans.name: Ali Ahmad

texts.en: Ali Ahmed is a 45-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of six children, five of whom go to school, and one of whom helps him in his business. Ali has owned a dairy farm in his town since 1993. Ali milks the buffaloes twice a day, which is very hard work for one person. A few days ago, one of his cattle suddenly died, due to fetal disease, and the cowshed has fallen down due to lot of rain, so it needs maintenance. These difficulties are having a bad effect on his sales. Ali wants to buy a buffalo and repair the cowshed, but his savings are not sufficient for these purposes, so he applied for a loan of PKR 250,000 from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can overcome these difficulties and carry on his business smoothly. From the profits, Ali would like to start his own livestock breeding business, as he has now acquired sufficient experience in this business.  Ali Ahmed is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for his dairy business and repair his cowshed.

loans.name: Eitigar

texts.en:
Eitigar is 50 years old. He lives in the Gardabani District with his wife and two children. Eitigar applied for loans from local financial institutions several times, for an agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time, because of his low income. Eitigar’s economic activity is a farm where various of greens are grown. The family sells the harvest at the capital city’s open market. 

Eitigar applied for a loan from Credo to start up a dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products.  The rural poor do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the credit, Eitigar will buy  two milk cows and two calves. He will place them in an old empty farm building located in their yard. Eitigar will work hard on the farm. He will produce dairy products and sell them in the village. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows and calves.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a single lady, 32 years old, the mother of three children. She sells handbags and ladies’ shoes from place to place. She lives in Limuru, Kenya. Rahab has been in this business for two years and receives a monthly income of KES 16,000. This will be Rahab's first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy a new stock of handbags and shoes. In the future, she wants to open a boutique to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of shoes and handbags to sell.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en: This group is made up of traders who are applying for loans so they can raise their businesses to a sustainable level. This is their fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and their first with Kiva.  One of the members is Grace, 37, who is single and has two children. She has been selling ladies’ wear by hawking to customers for two years. Her two sons come home from school every day to help sell at home, so their mother can go out and sell. She will invest this loan in a bale of ladies’ clothing. Grace is standing in the middle the photograph. The other members include Mary, 30, who runs a cosmetics shop, and Janet, 36, who runs a grocery shop.

loans.use: to invest in a bale of ladies' clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 45 años de edad, su familia está compuesta de tres miembros, ella su hermana y su madre, es una familia de escasos recursos económicos, vive en la comunidad de Mizque. Trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria, produce cebolla, papa y frejol; los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. Doña María es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la alimentación y el cuidado de su hermana que quedo paralitica después de un accidente y su madre que ya no trabaja por la vejes y la debilidad,desde muy pequeñas quedaron huérfanas al fallecimiento de su padre, con mucho sacrificio trabajando desde pequeña adquirieron sus tierras donde hoy trabaja y cultivando hortalizas.  Doña María, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más abono químico, abono orgánico y agroquímicos para tener más producción y de mejor calidad y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old. Her family is made up of three people, herself, her sister, and her mother. It is a family with few economic resources. She lives in the community of Mizque.

She works in agriculture and livestock, producing onions, potatoes, and beans; she markets them in the same place where vendors, from the same community of Mizque, live.

She is a well-respected person in the community for her dedication to her work and for being responsible for her nourishing and taking care of her sister, who was paralyzed after accident. Her mother does not work due to age and weakness. Since they were little, they were orphans due to the death of their father. With a lot of sacrifice working since they were little, they acquired their land where they work cultivate vegetables.

Maria is requesting this current loan to buy more chemical fertilizer, organic fertilizer, and agricultural chemicals to have a more production at a higher quality. This way she will improve the quality of life of all her family.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer, organic fertilizer, and agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of drinks.

loans.name: Dolrosa

texts.en:
Dolrosa is 56 years old and hails from Usenge in Kisumu,Kenya. She supports 3 people in her family. She is a widow and she has two adult children who support themselves.

She sells fish, a business that she has been doing for the last 21 years, and generates a monthly income of Kes 80000. Due to challenges in getting enough capital for her business, Dolrosa has requested a loan from KADET LTD. This being her forth loan, she will use it to increase the volume of her daily stock by purchasing more fish and also to repair her boat, which is another source of income. She will use the anticipated profit to forge ahead with her business.

Dolrosa's dream is to expand her business and have a stable life.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and to repair her boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two dairy cows, ten pigs to raise, and the feed and vitamins for the animals.

loans.name: Danny Jose

texts.es:
Danni tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC CRISTO REY, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto El Cañal, pertenece al Canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias.

Danni se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol galdúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas y enfermedades. El sueño es tener dinero comprar mas terrenos y un vehiculo para transportar los productos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y todos los domingos ir a misa.
texts.en: Danny, 32, is married and has three children. He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, Los Rios province. He is a member of the Cristo Rey communal bank, which is located in the El Cañal area. It's part of Ventanas canton where they work in agriculture and ranching. Danny works in agriculture, planting corn and pigeon peas. He is asking for a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, manure, and liquid herbicide. He will buy the products in the city of Ventanas.
