He will be able to buy these supplies with the help of the loan. He faces challenges like infestations and illnesses. His dream is to have money to buy more land and a vehicle to transport his goods. In his free time, he likes to play sports and go to mass every Sunday.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, manure, and liquid herbicide.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 48-year-old man from a place known as Lubao Market in Kakamega, Kenya. He supports eight people in his family and is married to Grace, who is a small scale farmer. Frederick has seven children who are 18, 16, 15, 13, 10, eight and five-years-old respectively.

Fredrick has a retail shop where he sells drinking water to the community. He has been operating this business for the last eight years and comfortably generates a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). Fredrick is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more jerry-cans for storing water. He will put the anticipated profit back into the business.

Fredrick's dream is to have a stable business and take good care for his children.

loans.use: to purchase jerry-cans for storing water.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en: Ketevan is 26 years old, married, and lives in the small town of Rustavi with her husband and two children (4 and 6 years old). Her husband is an artisan and earns a small income. Ketevan is involved in a trading business. She buys clothing and household items in Turkey and resells these items among her friends and neighbors. She has requested a loan from Credo to expand the business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products. These people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. Ketevan will purchase clothes, shoes, and various of items in Turkey for wholesale prices and resell them for a profit. It will be hard work for Ketevan, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in trading to increase her inventory and sales volume. Ketevan is a very enthusiastic young lady with a great desire to get ahead. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter des pagnes et basins pour ses clients, madame Kayi âgée de 52ans et mère de 02 enfants (20 et 15ans) dont 01 scolarisé, sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour atteindre son objectif. Son premier prêt a été soldé sans aucun problème et espère avec le profit tiré réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Kayi is 52 years old and the mother of two children, aged 20 and 15.  One of her children goes to school.  In order to reach her goals, she is requesting her second loan from WAGES to buy damask fabrics and "pagnes" (traditionally printed West African fabrics) for resale to her customers.  Her first loan was settled without any problem and she hopes to make enough profits to reinvest in her activity and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase damask cloth and pagnes (traditionally printed West African fabrics).

loans.name: Famadin

texts.en:
Famadin is a 43-year-old married man. He lives in the small village of Marneuli district with his wife, Shekhla. The only source of income for their family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a greenhouse, where tomatoes are grown. They sell the harvested tomatoes at local markets at a good price.
 
As the existing income is not enough for his family, Famadin has decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Famadin applied to MFO Credo for a loan. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

With the loan of $2500, Famadin will purchase calves and feed for them. He will also renovate the shed and as the calves are raised, he plans to resell them at higher price. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased.

loans.use: to purchase calves and renovate a shed.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 40-year-old mother from Kigunga, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She supports four people in her family and is married to Mr. Chagala who is also a businessman and supports the family. They have three children.

Janet has a grocery store where she sells fruit and vegetables. She has operated this business for the last five years. She earns a monthly income of 3,900 Kenyan Shillings (KES). This is Janet's third loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase more green groceries and fruits. 

Janet will put the anticipated profit back into her business. Her dream is to have a happy family and a good business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is 27-years-old, married and a father of one child. For the last five years, he has earned a living by selling fruit and vegetables from his food kiosk in Malindi. Jason earns a monthly income of about 10,400 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from the business. 

Jason was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer. He is applying for his second loan of 30,000 KES to buy additional stock for his kiosk such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions, to sell to his customers. 

Jason will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his child, to take care of his family and to continue expanding his business. Jason's goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he may improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Angela Beatriz

texts.es:
Angela tiene 31 años de edad de estado civil unida tiene dos  hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC CRISTO REY, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto El Cañal, pertenece al Canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias.

Angela se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol galdúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas y enfermedades. El sueño es tener dinero para comprar mas terrenos para seguir trabajando ademas sueña con comprar bicicletas para los hijos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Angela is 31 years old and is in a common-law marriage.  She has two children, and she lives with her husband and children in the city of Ventanas in Los Rios province.  

Angela is a member of the communal bank "Cristo Rey," which is located in the Recinto El Cañal in Ventanas canton.  She works in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Angela cultivates corn and pigeon peas. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies, including organic and chemical fertilizers and liquid herbicide.  She purchases her supplies and sells her products in the city of Ventanas.  With the help of this loan she will be able to buy supplies.

Angela confronts certain challenges in her work, including pests and crop diseases.  Her dream is to have money to buy more land so that she can continue to work.  She also dreams of purchasing bicycles for her children.

In her free time, Angela enjoys cleaning the house.

loans.use: to buy supplies: organic and chemical fertilizers and liquid herbicide

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es: EL cliente Victor  es una persona trabajadora, organizada y responsable, tiene veintiséis años, su estado civil es de soltero, es una persona joven con aspiraciones de crecimiento,  su actividad principal es la producción de gladiolos, actualmente está viviendo con sus padres y hermanos menores en una humilde casa, donde también está ubicado la actividad de la producción de gladiolos, desde que era pequeña comenzó la actividad, ayudando a sus padres, quienes por la edad que cuenta ya no pueden dedicarse a esta actividad. El señor Victor se siente agradecido por la enseñanza de sus padres en la realización de esta actividad. El señor Victor menciona que actualmente la actividad de la producción de gladiolos es la principal fuente de ingresos de su familia.  El crédito que solicita el señor Victor es para la compra de semilla de gladiolos, con esto quiere incrementar su producción de gladiolos y generar mas ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Victor is a hard-working, organized and responsible person. He is twenty-six years old and single. He is a young person who aspires to grow. His main activity is growing gladioluses. Currently he is living with his parents and younger siblings in a humble house, which is also where the gladioluses are grown. He has done this work since he was young, helping his parents, who he says can no longer do this work because of their age. Victor is thankful for  his parents teaching him to do this work. Victor mentions that currently growing gladioluses is the main source of income for his family. The loan Victor is requesting is to buy gladiolus seed. With this, he hopes to increase his gladiolus production and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy gladiolus seed

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 53-year-old lady from Bugumbe which is found within Migori county in Kenya. She supports 6 people in her family, she is married to Mr. Joseph who is also a businessman and supports the family. She has 5 children who are 25, 19, 18, 17 and 16 years old.

She sells cereals, a business she has been doing for the last year and comfortably generates a monthly income of KES 9,000. She has applied for her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase maize, beans, and millet. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back (reinvest) into the business.

Her dream is to be able to expand the business and take good care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals for sale

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Doña Adelaida, tiene 28 años de edad, su familia está compuesta de tres miembros dos hijos y la madre, es una familia de escasos recursos económicos, vive en la comunidad de Mizque. Trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria, produce cebolla, papa y frejol; los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. Doña Adelaida es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos. Desde que se separa el marido queda sola, por la necesidad de recursos trabaja en las tierras de su padre y con mucho sacrificio agarra algunos recursos para los gastos de su familia.  Doña Adelaida, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más abono químico, abono orgánico y agroquímicos para tener más producción y de mejor calidad y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 28 years old.  Her family consists of herself and 2 children.  This is a low income family that lives in the community of Mizque.  Adelaida works in agriculture and animal husbandry.  She produces onions, potatoes and beans which she sells in the same place that she lives to the traders of Mizque.  

Adelaida is a person who is well-respected in the community for her dedication to her work, and for being responsible for feeding and educating her children.  Ever since she separated from her husband she's been on her own.  In order to generate resources she works on land that her father owns.  With a lot of sacrifice, she manages to obtain some resources for her family's expenses.  

Adelaida is requesting this loan to buy more organic and chemical fertilizers and agro-chemicals so that she can increase her production and improve the quality of her crops.  In this way, she will improve the living conditions for all of the members of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers and agro-chemicals

loans.name: Edison Rafael

texts.es:
Edison tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil unido tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC CRISTO REY, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto El Cañal, pertenece al Canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias.

Edison se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol galdúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y una bomba para fumigar.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas y enfermedades. El sueño es tener dinero comprar mas terrenos y seguir sembrando

En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirse los domingos con la familia.
texts.en:
Edison is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the Cristo Rey (Christ the King) communal bank located in the rural community of El Cañal in Ventanas canton. They work in farming and raising livestock.

Edison is a farmer and grows corn and pigeon peas. He is asking for the loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, manure, and an insecticide spray pump.

He will make the purchases in the city of Ventanas. 

He faces challenges such as infestations and illnesses. His dream is to have money to buy more land and to keep planting.

In his free time, he likes to get together with the family on Sundays.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizer, manure, and an insecticide spray pump

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana tiene 43 años de edad de estado civil casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC CRISTO REY, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto El Cañal, pertenece al Canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias.

Juana se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol galdúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y una bomba para fumigar.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas y enfermedades. El sueño es tener dinero comprar mas terrenos para que los hijos trabajen.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Juana is 43 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province.

She is a member of the Cristo Rey (Christ the King) communal bank located in the rural village of El Cañal in Ventanas canton. They work in farming and raising livestock.

Juana is a farmer and grows corn and pigeon peas. She is asking for the loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, manure, and an insecticide spray pump.

She will buy the products in the city of Ventanas.

She faces challenges such as infestations and illnesses. Her dream is to have money to buy more land so that her children can work.

In her free time, she likes to do sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizer, manure, and an insecticide spray pump

loans.name: Marith Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 57 años de edad de estado civil casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC CRISTO REY, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto El Cañal, pertenece al Canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias.

Margarita se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol galdúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y una bomba para fumigar.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas y enfermedades. El sueño es tener dinero para salir de viaje a la playa

En el tiempo libre le gusta cocinar postres para la familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is 57 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province.

She is a member of the Cristo Rey (Christ the King) communal bank located in the rural village of El Cañal in Ventanas canton. They work in farming and raising livestock.

Margarita is a farmer and grows corn and pigeon peas. She is asking for the loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, manure, and an insecticide spray pump.

She will buy the products in the city of Ventanas.

She faces challenges such as infestations and illnesses. Her dream is to have money to go on a trip to the beach.

In her free time, she likes to make desserts for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizer, manure and an insecticide spray pump

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Jeune femme, Afi se bat chaque fois pour rendre pérenne son activité et assurer ses propres besoins. Elle n'a pas d'enfant en charge et revend depuis 2005 des produits d’alimentation générale au marché. Avec son quatrième crédit, elle va s’approvisionner en marchandise (riz, huile végétale, tomate et autres…) Afi espère développer son activité.
texts.en: A young woman, Afi struggles each day to make her business sustainable and to ensure she can support herself. She has no children to support and has been selling grocery items at the market since 2005. With her fourth loan, she is going to stock up on merchandise (rice, vegetable oil, tomatoes, and more…). Afi hopes to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell in the market

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse d’œufs depuis 2011, Akossiwa demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises (œufs) afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Âgée de 30ans, elle est mariée à un agronome et maman d’01 enfant de 05ans scolarisé. Madame Akossiwa souhaite avoir une activité prospère et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: A seller of eggs since 2011, Akossiwa is asking for her first loan from WAGES to purchases merchandise (eggs) to respond to the needs of her customer. She is 30 years old, married to an agronomist, and a mom with a 5-year-old child in school. Ms. Akossiwa would like to have a prosperous business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne, 33, is a single mother of two children aged fourteen and nine. She runs a soft drink retail shop in Bomet, Kenya and has been in the business for the last year. Her monthly income averages around at 28,000 KES.

Evelyne learned about KADET from a credit officer who operates in Bomet town. She has acquired a first loan of 20,000 KES which will enable her to buy a stock of soft drinks in bulk since its cheaper and economical for Evelyne. This will translate to higher sales.

She plans to use the proceeds to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to own a residential plot in Mulot, which is on the outskirts of Bomet town, Narok County in Kenya.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks in bulk for retail sale.

loans.name: Al-Rhma Group

texts.en: This is a group of women with initiative, values and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays. The group is called Al-Rhma and consists of three ladies. They live in Aden, Yemen, and each is interested in developing her business. They requested a loan of 120,000 YER. Aswan is the group leader. She is 39, married, and the mother of four children. Her business is selling perfumes and incense, which has been her sole source of income for the last few years. She began this activity as a result of taking a loan from AMB. She is very grateful to her neighbors who have supported her over all these years. With the income from her business, she has been able to upgrade her home and enjoy more comfort. She has a small house. Therefore, she applied for the loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil unido tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC CRISTO REY, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto El Cañal, pertenece al Canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias.

Miguel se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol galdúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas y enfermedades. El sueño es tener dinero comprar mas terrenosy seguir sembrando

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Miguel is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas in De los Rios province. Miguel belongs to the “Christ the King” communal bank, located in Recinto El Canal, in Ventanas canton, which is dedicated to agricultural and fishing work.

Miguel is a farmer who sows corn and kidney beans. He is requesting a loan to purchase inputs, fertilizers, manure, and liquid pesticide, which he will purchase in the city of Ventanas with the aid of this loan.

Miguel confronts challenges such as plant desease and illness. His dream is to have the money to purchase more land and to continue sowing his crops. 

In his free time, Miguel likes to play sports.

loans.use: buy inputs such as fertilizers, manure, and liquid pesticides for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Deiner Enrique

texts.es: Deiner, nació y creció en el campo, donde aprendió las labores y tareas agropecuarias gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres y abuelos; es padre de 1 hijo de 2 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Actualmente se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura y es jornalero, trabaja todos los días desde las 5:00 de la mañana arando la tierra y preparando el terreno para sembrar, posee cultivos de yuca y ají en un pequeño lote de su propiedad, luego vende la cosecha y es así como ha logrado obtener los recursos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Deiner es un hombre luchador, emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por eso solicita el apoyo del crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, semillas, fungicidas) con el fin de seguir cuidando sus cultivos para obtener una cosecha con productos de mejor calidad, que puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio en el mercado local, así podrá aumentar sus ingresos y avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, que es comprar lotes de tierra por  hectáreas y cultivar más variedad de productos para ofrecerle un mejor bienestar a su familia y una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en: Deiner was born and raised in the country, where he learned agricultural work thanks to the teachings of his parents and grandparents. He is the father of one two-year-old son and he lives with his common-law wife. Currently he works in agriculture as a day laborer. He works every day from 5:00 in the morning ploughing the land and preparing it for planting. He has yucca and bell pepper crops on a small plot on his property. He then sells the harvest, and it is in this way that he has been able to obtain the resources to sustain his household. Deiner is a man who is a fighter, entrepreneurial and with a lot of desire to move ahead. Therefore, he is asking for the support of a loan to buy agricultural supplies (manure, seed, fungicide) with the goal of continuing to care for his crops in order to obtain a harvest with better-quality produce that can be sold at a better price in the local market. In this way he will be able to increase his income and advance one step further towards the fulfillment of his principal goal, which is to buy plots of land by the hectare and grow a wider variety of products in order to offer his family greater well-being and his son a good education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (manure, seed, fungicide)

loans.name: Tamuna

texts.en:
Tamuna is 21 years old. She lives in the Gardabani District with her husband and two infant children. Her husband works at a private company and gets a small salary. The family owns several hens and sells eggs from time to time. They live in poverty because the income is not enough for their four-member family. 

Tamuna requested a loan to start a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans with reasonable terms to start-up businesses. These loans are provided to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low incomes. The loan will be used for purchasing a milk cow. She will place the cow in the cattle shed located in her yard and will start selling the milk at the local market. The family's income will increase by 150–200 GEL (Georgian Lari), which is a 40–50% increase. The family's living conditions will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to start a dairy farm

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine is 22, married, and the mother of one child. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling household items in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 7,800 KES. Mourine was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and she is applying for her first loan. This loan of 30,000 KES will help her purchase additional stock, such as new basins, lighting lamps, water buckets and such other items to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her child as well as expand her business. Mourine's goal for the future is to own a well-established general store in the area so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her business.

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Jeanne est leader  du groupe de crédit  « Utulivu», entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 53 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui ont déjà leurs foyers respectifs.  Son conjoint est un vendeur de pneus de véhicules. La cliente est vendeuse de boissons (Fanta, coca, Primus, l’eau Vive, jus, lait caillé). Elle installe ses produits à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 17 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter boissons (15 casiers de Fanta & coca, 20 casiers de Primus, 10 cartons l’eau Vive Rwenzori, 8 cartons jus maltis, 2bidons lait caillé, etc.). Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses petits fils et acheter une seconde parcelle. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.Il sied de signaler que cette photo fut prise dans un lieu étroitement caché dans un bidonville pour se sécuriser contre les criminelles lors des activités de décaissement de prêt.
texts.en:
This client, Jeanne, is the group leader of the loan group "Utulivu". An experienced entrepreneur, she is 53 years old and the mother of two children, who already have their own respective homes. Her husband is a vendor of tires. This client sells beverages (Fanta, cola, Primus, Vive water, juices, curdled milk). She started her business about seventeen years ago with her own funds from her husband. This new loan will be used to purchase beverages (15 cases of Fanta and cola, 20 cases of Primus, 10 boxes of Vive Rwenzori water, 8 boxes of 'maltis' juices, 2 containers of curdled milk, etc.) Thus, she would like to grow her enterprise, purchase a second plot of land, and educate and feed her grandchildren.

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support for small-scale entrepreneurs. It should be noted that this photo was taken in a tight location tucked away in a shantytown for safety purposes against criminals while the loan funds are being disbursed.

loans.use: to purchase beverage (Fanta, cola, Primus, water, milk, etc.) to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ukweli Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chirezi est leader  du groupe de crédit  « Ukweli», doyenne,  entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 67 ans et mère d’un enfant qui a déjà son foyer.  Son conjoint est un chômeur, sans emploi. La cliente est vendeuse de boissons sucrées (Fanta, coca, jus). Elle installe ses produits à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 30 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 10 casiers de Fanta. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses petits fils et acheter une parcelle pour ces petits fils. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: This client, Chirezi, is the leader of the loan group "Ukweli". The senior member and an experienced entrepreneur, she is 67 years old and the mother of one child, who already has a home. Her husband is unemployed. This client sells soft drinks (Fanta, cola, juices). Her products are set up in her home. She started her business with her own funds from her husband about thirty years ago. This new loan will be used to purchase 10 cases of Fanta. Thus, she would like to grow her enterprise, purchase a second plot of land for her grandchildren, and educate and feed them. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support for small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase Fanta softdrinks to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Jose tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene tres hijos vive con la compañera y con los hijos en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Jose se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades y semillas.  

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo y en Ventanas.

El sueño es contruir la casa ya que vive en casa arrendada, en los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte como jugar indor.
texts.en:
Jose is 33 and lives in a common-law relationship. He has three children and lives with his partner and children in the community of Terrenal in the Pueblo Viejo canton in Los Rios province. He belongs to the Terrenal Community Bank which is located in the Terrenal district of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. He works in agriculture and cattle-raising.

Jose is a farmer who plants corn and rice. With the loan he will be able to purchase supplies such as fertilizer, manure, insecticides to prevent pests and diseases, and seeds. He does his purchasing in the towns of Pueblo Viejo and Ventanas.

His dream is to build his own house since he lives in a rented house. In his free time he likes to play sports such as indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, insecticides to prevent pests and diseases, and seeds

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil Soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres y con dos hermandos de 15 y 12 años en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo y en Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener dinero para ponerse un negocio propio como es una tienda de abarrotesa ya que donde viven no hay, en los tiempos libres jugar bolly.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 years old. He is single with no children. He lives with his parents and his two siblings who are 15 and 12 years old. They live in the community of Terrenal, part of the Pueblo Viejo canton in the Los Rios province.

Carlos belongs to the Terrenal communal bank, which is located in Terrenal, part of the Pueblo Viejo canton. It focuses on agricultural work and raising livestock. 

Carlos works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. With this loan, he will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizers, manure, and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases. He will make his purchases in the cities of Pueblo Viejo and Ventanas.

Carlos’s dream is to have money to start his own business such as a grocery store, since there are none where he lives. In his free time, Carlos plays volleyball.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases.

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es:
Bartola, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque le es factible trabajar con la Institución; esta inversión le permitirá comprar hilo de diferente colores,  hilo grueso, agujas, entre otros para la elaboración de hamacas.
El crédito anterior fue favorable, ya  que las condiciones económicas se han optimizado, por lo que logro obtener mejores ingresos e invertir más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Bartola has the need to apply for a new loan because she is able to work with this institution. This investment will allow her to buy coloured thread, thick thread and needles, among other things necessary to make hammocks.

Her previous loan was favourable, since her financial conditions have improved and she is able to have a higher income and invest more in her business.

loans.use: to buy coloured thread, thick thread and needles, among other things.

loans.name: Mededjro Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MEDEDJRO est formé de quinze personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même vilalge au Bénin et sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Séraphine Thérèse est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Séraphine Thérèse est âgée de 64 ans, et est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a six enfants, dont deux restent à leur charge. Aucun des enfants n'est scolarisé. Séraphine Thérèse a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Depuis vingt ans, Séraphine Thérèse vend de l'huile de palme et des légumes et charbon de bois de façon secondaire à son domicile ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Séraphine Thérèse achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Séraphine Thérèse et les autres membres du groupement MEDEDJRO sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur fonds de roulement, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group MEDEDJRO is composed of fifteen persons who are friends all living in the same village in Benin. The group's representative, Séraphine Thérèse, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 64 years old and married to a man named Jean. The couple have six children, of whom two are still in their care. None of the children are in school. 

Séraphine Thérèse dropped out of primary school. For twenty years, she has been selling palm oil and vegetables, and charcoal on the side, out of her home. This enables her along with her husband to ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. She purchases her products in Benin.

This is the first time that Séraphine Thérèse and the other members of the group MEDEDJRO have requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to bolster their businesses and to increase their working capital in order to respond to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, vegetables, etc. to sell and meet customer demands

loans.name: Florentina Adelaida

texts.es:
Florentina tiene 35 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene siete hijos vive con el compañero y con los hijos en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Florentina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es viajar en avion a otro pais, en los tiempos libres le gusta ver television sobre todo las noches las novelas.
texts.en:
35-year old Florentina lives with her common-law husband and seven children in Terrenal, a part of the Pueblo Viejo canton in Los Ríos province.

She belongs to the Terrenal Community Bank located in Terrenal in Pueblo Viejo canton which is involved in agriculture and raising animals. Florentina herself grows corn. With the loan money she will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and insecticide so her crops will not suffer from disease and insect infestations. She buys her supplies in the town of Pueblo Viejo.

Florentina's dream is to travel by plane to another country. In her free time she likes to watch television especially when the soaps are on.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital para continuar en su negocio; este le servirá para comprar más mercadería tales como: jabón, aceite, especies, huevos, cebollas, repollos, tomates, zanahorias, entre otros.
El crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que logro mejorar y surtir el negocio, agregando otros productos porque hoy en dia cuenta con una mini tienda; las circunstancias familiares han mejorado y su sueño es apoyar siempre a su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is requesting a new loan because she is in need of more capital to carry on with her business. This loan will help her buy more merchandise such as soap, oil, spices, eggs, onions, cabbages, tomatoes, carrots and others.

The previous loan was very useful, as she was able to improve and stock up her business and add other products. Nowadays she has a small shop. Her family circumstances have improved and her dream is to always support her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, oil, spices, eggs, onions, cabbages, tomatoes, carrots and others

loans.name: Turizeranye Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline fait partie du groupe Turizeranye et habite à Gitega. Elle a 37 ans et est mariée à Pascal, un réparateur de vélo. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgé de 3 à 9 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de sorgho depuis 7ans.

Elle est à son seizième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de kilos de sorgho, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Grâce au gain de son commerce, elle a déjà acheté un terrain cultivable.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is part of the group Turizeranye and lives in Gitega. She is 37 years old and married to Pascal, a bicycle repairman. Together they have four children, from 3 to 9 years old, of whom three are students. 

Jacqueline has been doing commerce in sorghum for seven years. 

She is on her sixteenth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many kilos of sorghum, so as to earn more. 

Thanks to the profits from her business, she has already purchase some arable land.

loans.use: to purchase many kilos of sorghum to sell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Ana Mildres

texts.es:
Doña Ana es una mujer con una edad de 38 años, casada, ama de casa y agricultora desde muy joven ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra en lo que es el cultivo de café, maíz y frijol. Ella es madre de 4 hijos los cuales el mayor tiene 9 años de educación, la segunda hizo la primaria completa y los últimos 2 estudian en diferentes grados de educación en la primaria, con ella vive un nieto también. El terreno que ella en compañía de su esposo cultivan es propio gracias a una compra que le hicieron a uno de sus clientes hace algún tiempo el cual esta ubicado a 15 minutos de camino y algunas ocasiones se traslada a en bestia.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual ella podrá dar una mejor asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café como una limpieza, fertilización, abono, entre otros que darán mejores resultados al final de la cosecha.   

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder cultivar una mejor variedad de café como el borbon, caturra, lempira y otros que hagan su producto competitivo y atractivo en el mercado local y nacional. Sus sueños es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales con carreras universitarias.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old, married and is both a housewife and farmer. She has worked in agriculture ever since she was a young girl when her parents taught her about the land where she now grows coffee, corn, and beans. Ana has four children. The eldest attended school for nine years, the second completed primary school, and the last two are in different grades in primary school. A grandson also lives with her.

The land she and her husband work is their own thanks to a purchase from one of their customers some time ago. It is located 15 minutes away by road; sometimes she goes there by horse or donkey.

Ana is seeking a loan from the Comixmul Cooperative so she can pay for technical assistance with her crops. She would like to know more about weeding, fertilization, manure etc. in order to get better harvests.

Her future plan is to be able to grow a better variety of coffee like Bourbon, Caturra, and Lempira so that the beans she grows will be competitive and attractive to local and national markets.

Ana's dream is to see her children attend university and get good jobs.

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies and pay for technical assistance

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a twenty-four-year-old cafe owner in Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and the mother of one child. Janet's husband helps provide for the family through additional income.

Janet has been running her business for the last four years and it's doing well.

This marks her third borrowing from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, milk, sugar and tea leaves for her cafe and the anticipated profit will be used to expand her cafe's seating capacity. She hopes to own a modern cafe in the future and live a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, milk, sugar and tea leaves for her cafe

loans.name: Doris Yaneth

texts.es: La señora Doris,  tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida, y hace mas de 3 años estableció otro negocio de una pulpería donde trabaja 14 horas diarias vendiendo productos de la canasta básica, como Arroz, azúcar, frijoles, lácteos, pastas, embutidos, productos de abarrotes etc. Con este negocio ha salido adelante y esta motivada a seguir trabajando. Ha invertido varios préstamos para mantener estable el negocio. Actualmente solicita el séptimo préstamo que es por 25,000 Lempiras el cual lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, lácteos, y abarrotes para surtir la pulpería. Ella espera seguir creciendo en el negocio y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y poder darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Doris is 46 years old, she is a single mother, she has 2 children and she lives in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Previously engaged in selling meals, more than 3 years ago she opened a grocery store where she works 14 hours a day selling basic necessities such as rice, sugar, beans, dairy products, pasta, sausages and groceries. She has succeeded in getting ahead thanks to this activity and she is determined to keep on working. She has invested in a few loans in order to keep her activity stable. This will be her seventh loan and she is requesting 25,000 lempiras that she will invest in the purchase of basic grains, dairy products and groceries to stock up her store. She wishes for her activity to keep on growing, and she hopes to succeed in improving her family’s standard of living as well as to succeed in granting an education to her children.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, dairy products and groceries.

loans.name: Chawkat

texts.en:
Chawkat is a 29-year-old married father of three children. He is a Palestinian refugee who works hard to provide his family with the necessary living needs. Chawkat has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2003. His work is based in the Palestinian Camp he and his family have been living in since they were born.

Chawkat is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to build two rooftops for his shop to expand his working area and prepare it for the coming winter season. This is Chawkat's eighth loan cycle from Al Majmoua. He is in good standing with a good paying back history. His precious loans helped him a lot in expanding his business and increasing his income, which reflected positively on his socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To build two rooftops for his shop to expand his working area and prepare it for the coming winter season

loans.name: Silveria Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Antonia tiene 35 años,  ella se dedica al  bordado de prendas de vestir como  disfraces folklóricos, de distintas fraternidades,  ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, es trabajo que realiza es manual y le lleva mucho trabajo, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Los Andes , este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Antonia utilizara este préstamo para compra de telas y materiales para el bordado de sus prendas de vestir, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Antonia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad del bordado de disfraces y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y no solo bordar si no confeccionar variedad de prendas de vestir la Sra. Antonia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Antonia is 35 years old. She makes a living embroidering garments such as folkloric costumes from different regions. She has been doing this for several years. It is manual labor and it takes a lot of hard work. Her workshop is located in the Los Andes zone.

This is her first loan with this field partner and Antonia will use it to buy fabric and materials to embroider garments. She is requesting this loan because she lacks working capital. Antonia faces challenges in her business including the need to continue improving the quality of embroidery on her costumes. She is going to use her profits to continue increasing her working capital. Her desire is for her business to grow and to not only embroider, but to also make a variety of garments. Antonia is happy and grateful for the field partner’s support.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make costumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sack of dried fish to sell at her business

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
Victorina, es una persona muy reconocida en la comunidad, vive actualmente con su compañero de vida y disfruta de dos hijos mayores de edad. Ella, se dedica al comercio, venta de frutas y verduras, lo realiza de 7:00am a 4:00pm, lo desempeña con su esposo desde hace 53 años, lo aprendió por necesidad económica, la ventaja con la que cuenta que lo realiza en su casa.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá  comprar variedad de mercadería tales como: tomates, zanahorias, cebollas,  chiles, uvas, manzanas, naranjas, entre otros para comercializarlo; esta inversión le ayudara a tener un negocio surtido que le permita generar más ganancias.
Su sueño es tener un negocio amplio que le genere una mayor rentabilidad económica, así mismo incrementar las posibilidades de salir adelante con el crédito.
texts.en:
Victorina is someone who is well known in her community. She currently lives with her partner and has two adult children. She runs a business selling fruit and vegetables and works from 7am to 4pm. She has been doing this with her husband for 53 years. She learnt the business through economic necessity and it has the advantage that she runs it from her home. 

The loan she is asking for will enable her to buy a variety of produce such as tomatoes, carrots, onions, chillies, grapes, apples, oranges and other items to sell. This investment will help her to have a well stocked business which will help her to make more profit. Her dream is to have an extensive business which gives her a better economic profitability, and in this way the loan increases her possibilities for making progress in life.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions, chillies, grapes, apples, oranges and other items.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: Lusine is from Kapan, where she lives with her school age daughter. Lusine started her business years ago. At that time, she was in a very difficult living condition and it was very difficult for her to tackle her financial hardships and sustain her daughter's life. After opening her catering business, Lusine was able to make a little improvement in her life and cover her daily costs. Due to her hard work and nice attitude toward people, Lusine has gained many loyal customers who prefer to come to Lusine's little cafe and enjoy tasty meals. Lusine is now more specialized in Georgian cuisine and cooks different types of meals which her customers enjoy with great pleasure. Lusine requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her start-up business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because her business isn't registered as a formal business. Lusine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Lusine to make improvements to her catering service and be able to meet the market demand.

loans.use: to improve her catering service.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 54-year-old dealer in second-hand clothing, in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a widow, who supports two children. She has been in the second-hand clothing business for the past six years, doing great.

This marks her 1st loan from KADET Ltd to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase bales of second-hand clothing to sell. She will use the anticipated income to service her loan. She hopes to grow her business and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, a father of two from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Margaret, who helps him in farming. He earns a monthly income of KES 11,000, which he uses to support his family. This marks his second loan term with KADET. 

With the loan he has applied for from KADET LTD, he will be able to purchase poultry feed and purchase one-day-old chicks to raise. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. In the future, George would like to build a permanent storehouse to keep his cereals and other grains, and also expand his cattle shed to keep more animals. He hopes to save money, to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and one-day-old chicks to raise

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 26-year-old lady from Kakamega, Kenya. She is married to Bernard, who is a small-scale farmer. Jackline supports her family through her income, which helps provide for her family. She has three children, who are 12, 10 and 5 years old.

Jackline has been trading in a small-scale retail shop, which she has been operating for the past two years. The business generates a monthly income of KES 5,100. She has applied for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more stock to offer for sale at the shop. She will use the anticipated profit to increase her business.

Jackline's dreams and hopes are to be able to grow her business into a wholesale shop, so as to sustain her family.

loans.use: To increase the stock at her shop

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 29-year-old from Eregi location in Vihiga county, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She supports two people in her family. Agnes is married to Esmond, and they have one child who is 13 years old.

Agnes has a greengrocery store, a business she has been doing for the past four years. She earns a monthly income of KES 3,900. She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to add more stock. She will use the anticipated profit to invest back into the business.

Her dream is to have a stable business and take good care of her family.

loans.use: To increase the stock of greengrocery items on offer at her business

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 66 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, Nanuli, in the small village of Tsnori district, East Georgia. Both of them are provided with a retirement pension. Tamaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only other source of the income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard. Tamaz does all the agricultural work and works hard to insure a good harvest. They sell wine at local markets. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tamaz requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Tamaz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Tamaz will purchase a milking cow. As the milking cow is purchased, his wife, Nanuli, will produce cheese products for selling. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 32-year-old mother from Kakamega, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports three people in her family and is married to Bernard, who is a farmer and supports the family by providing the income. She has two children who are ten and five years old.

Carolyne has a retail shop which she has been running for the last seven years and gets a monthly income of KES 5,600. She has applied for her third loan which she will use to purchase goods like sugar, salt, cooking oil and bar soap to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

Carolyne's dream is to have a big business and take good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, salt, cooking oil and bar soap to sell

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi is 53 years old, married, and a mother of three children. One of them is still in school. For the past twelve years, Kavumbi has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000.

Kavumbi was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000. She will use the loan to buy additional dairy equipment to use in her business, such as milk cans, milking gloves, water cans for the cows to drink from, and so on. Kavumbi will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her child who is in school, and to expand her farming activities.

Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming, with a view toward increasing her income, so as to help improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy equipment, such as milk cans, milking gloves, water cans for the cows to drink from, and so on.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a 28-year-old mother from Nyalenda, which is one of the slums in Kisumu city within the western part of Kenya. She supports five people in her family and is married to Samuel, who is also a small scale businessman. She has four children who are ten, six, four and two years old.

She sells secondhand clothes, a business she has been doing for the last ten years and generates a monthly income of KES 40,000. She is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more bales of secondhand clothes so as to increase her stock. This will enable her to get more income to support her family and sustain the business. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to grow the business and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso * 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PAZ Y PROGRESO * 26,  Está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes todas mujeres la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Hilaria,   tiene 28 años y tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 6 y 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de flores en su puesto de venta en un mercado de la zona central de la ciudad de la Paz,   este préstamo es su segunda  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Hilaria va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de flores por mayor ya que por estas fechas realiza ramos para la venta y tiene también pedido para distintos acontecimientos sociales su razón para solicitar este préstamo es poder entregar estos pedidos ya que le hace falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Hilaria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son poder expandirse en gran la variedad de flores decorativas para interiores y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la expansión de su negocio, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le dan a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos solas mantienen a sus familias.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurship group Paz Y Progresso *26 is composed of eight members, all of them women. Hilaria is the president of the group. She is 28 years old and has two children who are aged six and eight. 

Hilaria makes a living by selling flowers in her stall in a market in the centre of La Paz. This is her second loan cycle. Hilaria will use this loan to buy a variety of flowers in bulk, because she makes bouquets for sale around this time and has requests for several social events. She needs to fulfil these orders and lacks the working capital. 

Hilaria faces challenges, namely expanding the range of interior and decorative flowers, and will use the loan to expand her business. 

She is happy and thankful for this opportunity that has been given to her and the rest of the group members, since they very often have to support their families alone.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (various flowers)

loans.name: Kwasi's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two men who live in the same neighborhood and are involved in retail business. This is their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

Kwasi is the group's representative. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of two boys. Kwasi sells used jeans at the city market. He plans to use his portion of the loan to buy a bale of men's jeans for GHS 1,200. He has more than eight years of experience in his field. He will use his profits to meet his children's needs and increase his savings with ID-Ghana.

The other borrower is named Aaron.

loans.use: to buy a bale of men's jeans for GHS 1200.

loans.name: Amuna Magret

texts.en:
Amuna is a client of Finance Sudan Limited and she has borrowed three times before. 

She is a 40 year-old married mother of seven children. Five of her children go to school. She learnt about Finance Sudan and Kiva through Field Marketing. 

Amuna is a businesswoman. Her business involves selling food stuffs like beans, rice, flour and dry cassava. She is requesting a loan of 600 Sudanese Pounds. She intends to buy more stock for her business and use the profits to pay back the loan, pay school fees for her children and also feed her family.

loans.use: to buy items llike beans, rice, flour and dry cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy green bananas, rice, beef, onions, cooking oil, fresh beans, and chicken

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 38 year-old man from Majengo, in Kakamega county, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He supports four family members and is married to Polline who is a businesswoman. He has one child who is two years old.

Thomas owns a shop, a business he has been doing for the last 3 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 10,000. He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase items for his shop, such as sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and soap in bulk for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to diversify his business.

Thomas's dream and hope is to create employment opportunities for others by expanding his business, so as to employ more people to help him run the business. He also wishes to give his child the best education possible.

loans.use: to increase his stock by buying sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and soap, among others.

loans.name: Belindah

texts.en:
Belindah is a 36-year-old lady. She is married to Rodgers, a businessman, and they have three children, ages 3, 12, and 14.

Belindah has been operating a retail shop for the last five years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase goods for her retail shop. The items she will purchase include bar soap, cooking oil, and washing powder. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Belindah's dream is to educate her children and run a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her retail shop

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a 30-year-old married man. He lives with his wife Khatuna in a small village of Sighnaghi district. Zurab requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from their agricultural activities. In particular, they have two pigs and rabbits. In addition, they have a vineyard and produce wine seasonally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zurab requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Zurab will purchase a used car and two calves. As the calves are raised, he will be able to resell them at a higher price. Zurab will drive a car in the vineyard. When the car is purchased, he will be able to work more easily. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a used car and two calves

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya lives in a small city called Sevan, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Although Sevan is small, it is one of the most beautiful cities of the republic of Armenia, Zoya says. The lake in Sevan is a very nice and safe place to rest with family members and friends. There are a lot of interesting stories and beautiful legends connected with the lake of Sevan and its surroundings. For this reason, Sevan is frequently visited both by local citizens and tourists. 

Since Zoya specializes in sales, she has established her own retail business in Sevan. She rents a stall at the Sevan wholesale market, where she sells a large variety of products. She sells products that are seasonal as well as those needed for everyday use. In her stall, she sells boots, sneakers and rubber shoes along with a large variety of household goods. Zoya's family members are very happy and satisfied with the results of her business. 

Thanks to her business income, Zoya is able to provide for her elder daughter, who does not live with her, and her second daughter and her family, who live with her.

Zoya is a very clever businesswoman and she knows that this season is the best trading time. This is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy  seasonal products that are in great demand by tourists such as boots, sneakers and rubber shoes. She is sure that this loan will help her earn an increased income, especially since the summertime is a very busy time of year.

loans.use: to buy seasonal products (boots, sneakers and rubber shoes) that are in great demand by tourists.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 38-year-old lady from the Eregi location, which is found in Vihiga County in the western part of Kenya. She supports three people in her family and is married to Mr. Elphas, who is a small-scale farmer. She has two school-going children of ages 10 and 5 years old respectively.

Carolyne has a green grocery store within her local market, a business she has been doing for the last three years. She gets an income of KES 4,650 monthly. She is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase green grocery products for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

Carolyne's dream is to educate her children and run a successful business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of green grocery products.

loans.name: Naboth

texts.en:
Naboth is aged 38 and married. He has three children, all of whom attend school. He is a farmer, mainly growing coffee, matooke, maize and beans, for commercial purposes and home consumption. It is from agriculture that he gets money to look after his family.

Naboth has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (two million shillings). He will use this amount to buy materials for completing his residential house. He plans to pay back the loan in installments, using the income from agriculture. He wants to see his family living in a modest environment that is conducive to their well-being.

His major challenge is the changeable weather conditions affecting production of crops, as well as the price fluctuations on the market.

loans.use: To buy building materials for completing his residential house

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with five children, two of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members, including her sister and brother. 

Mariam has a business selling charcoal, and she has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through crafts and catering services. She works from home six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Mariam aspires to sell on a wholesale basis only and also to build rental rooms. She resides in a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include her children's school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Malita

texts.en: Malita is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice and cooking oil. She works six days out of very week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a Kiva borrower. He is married with two children, aged 7 years and 15 years. He describes himself as ambitious. He sells ties to earn a living and has been in this business for five years. He faces a challenge of lack of funds for his business.

He has taken a loan of KES 26,500 to buy a gas cooker that will benefit his family. This will enable his family to prepare food well without the smoke experienced when using firewood.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker that will benefit his family.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 28-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. She describes herself as trustworthy, humble, and God-fearing. To earn a living, Lilian sells clothes.

Lilian is requesting a loan of KES 10,840 to buy a gas cooker for her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit lives in the city of Gavar, which is in Gegharkunik region. Before getting married, for several years Davit was engaged in a trading business in the Russian Federation, but having no success there, he came back to his motherland. Today he is married, and he is the father of two cheerful and clever boys.  Here, with his nice wife, he established a small farm, and by the help of farming income he managed to buy a truck. Together with his farming activities, today Davit also transports people in his truck. The farming he manages with his wife; they have a cow, two calves, three piglets and fifteen chickens.

Since their farm is very small, they have decided to enlarge it. Davit asks for a loan in order to buy several cows and a bull. He is more than sure that great success and decent income are awaiting his family.

loans.use: to buy several cows and a bull, and he is more than sure that great success and decent income are awaiting his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a Kiva borrower aged 27 years, married with four children with ages between 7 years and one year old.He describes himself as dedicated and never gives up. He has taken out a loan of Kes 5,800 to buy a solar lantern that will benefit his family. His family faces a challenge of lack of electricity connection and high cost of paraffin. He spends a lot of money on fuel hence the need for a solar lantern  which will reduce fuel costs. 

Stephen transports customers from one place to another using his motorcycle to earn an income. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He hopes that in future he will be able to afford a water tank.

loans.use: buy a solar lantern

loans.name: Andres Fidel

texts.es:
Andres tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene un hijo vive con la compañera y con el hijo en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Andres se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es comprar un solar para construir una casa, en los tiempos libres le gusta ver las noticias en la letelevision
texts.en:
Andres is 25 years old and he is in a common-law relationship. He has one child and lives with his partner and their child in the precinct of Terrenal in the canton of Pueblo Viejo, in the province of Los Ríos.

He is originally from Terrenal, which is in the precinct of Terrenal in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. He makes a living in livestock and agriculture. In agriculture, he works planting corn and rice. 

With this loan, he will be able to buy supplies like fertilizers, compost, and pesticides to prevent pests and diseases. He makes his purchases in the city of Pueblo Viejo.

His dream is to buy a plot of land where he can build a house. In his free time, he likes to watch the news on TV.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and pesticides to prevent pests and diseases

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 20 years old. He lives in the Gardabani district with his mother and 4-year-old brother. In spite of his young age, Mikheil is the only income provider in the family, working as a daily worker in the local fields. He started working in early childhood and his small seasonal income is a primary income source for his family members. However, his earnings are not enough to cover the cost of food and everyday expenses. For this reason, Mikheil decided to start a dairy farm. 

Mikheil's loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans with reasonable terms to start-up businesses. These loans are provided to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low incomes. 

The loan will be used to purchase a milk cow. Mikheil will place the cow in the cattle shed located in his yard and he will sell the milk at the local market. He estimates that the family's income will increase by 150 to 200 GEL, which is a 40- to 50-percent increase. The family's living conditions will significantly improve, enabling them to access regular credit products that are currently available.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow to start a dairy farm.

loans.name: Agnes Fred

texts.en:
Agnes is a client of Finance Sudan; she has borrowed three times before now. She is 42 years old and a married mother of five children. Four of her children go to school. She is a businesswoman, who runs a restaurant. She has been in this business for about two years.

Agnes is borrowing the amount of 600 Sudanese Pounds, to expand her business. Her restaurant sells foods like beans, fish, meat and other local foods. She intends to use the money to buy more foodstuffs and to employ more staff to help her in the business. She will repay the loan from the profits she gets, and she will also be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs and employ more staff for her restaurant

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of an additional family member, her younger brother’s child. She and her family live in a house and have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills. 

Joyce operates a restaurant and has been in this business for four years. She works at the market six days every week. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more green bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, rice, beef, chicken and ground nuts.   

She aspires to own a fully-stocked restaurant and educate her children up to university-level.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, beef, chicken, rice, sweet and Irish potatoes, and ground nuts.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
For Jennifer, passion is the name of the game. “Dance has been a long-time passion of mine,” says Jennifer. “I’ve danced for 30 years of my life and want to share my love for it with young girls.” 

Originally from Chicago, Jennifer purchased a dance studio from its original owner six years ago. She offers dance lessons for several kinds of dance: ballet, tap, hip hop, pop, and waltz. She currently has around 130 students enrolled, but expects to see enrollment numbers rise during the summer months. In anticipation of this increased demand, she needs this financing to make renovations to her current space to improve the appearance of the school, and to purchase a new computer system to improve her customer service.

loans.use: To make renovations to her current space and purchase a new computer system

loans.name: Lisa Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 24-year-old Emmaculate from Mutare. Emmaculate is a group member of the group called Lisa Group. She is married with two children and are both attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. 

Emmaculate runs a clothing business which sells African attire and baby wear. The business has been in operation  for six years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of industrial sewing machines. Emmaculate has requested a loan of $400 to buy an overlock machine for the sewing business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. 

In the future Emmaculate plans to operate her business in town where there are more clients.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine for the sewing business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 35-year old Kiva borrower. She describes herself as God-fearing and hopeful. Ruth farms for a living.

She is married and has five children who are between the ages of 1 and 16. She is requesting a loan of KES 15,600 to buy a 2,300 liter water tank. Her family faces a challenge of accessing clean water and this tank will benefit her eight-member family. The tank will enable them to store clean water for domestic use. 

This is Ruth's second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She hopes to provide both physical and spiritual security for her family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a Kiva borrower aged 30 years. He is married and has four children with ages between 10 years and 2 years old. He describes himself as dedicated and determined. 

He has borrowed a loan of Kes 5,800 to buy a solar lantern that will benefit his family.They do not have electricity hence the need for a solar lantern. He will also be able to reduce kerosene expenses and mobile charging expenses since they will be able to charge their phones with the solar lamp.
