loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marina Elena

texts.es:
La señora Marina de 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos que depende de ella, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en la zona centro de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada desde hace 8 años.
Doña Marina sus clientes son los vecinos, amigos y también sus compañeros de trabajo ya que labora en una compañía de limpieza es una mujer muy luchadora que desea salir adelante.
Doña Marina el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, calzonetas, etc. Espera que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia al tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Doña Marina su sueño es que su negocio sea más grande y poder ayudar siempre a su familia.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Julio del 2013
texts.en:
Señora Marina is 49 years old, lives with her spouse, and has 2 children who depend on her. She lives in a neighbourhood of Tegucigalpa, in the central zone of Honduras. For 8 years she has dedicated herself to selling new and used clothing.

Doña Marina's customers are her neighbours, friends, and also her coworkers, as she works at a cleaning company. She is a very hard-working woman who wants to get ahead in life.

Doña Marina needs this loan to purchase pants, dresses, skirts, shirts, bathing suits, etc. She hopes that this investment will help her improve her quality of life and that of her family by offering more products to her customers. 

Doña Marina's dream is that her business will become bigger and can always help her family.

loans.use: to purchase pants, dresses, skirts, shirts, bathing suits, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lita works hard to support her family. She has a business making nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lita is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional raw materials such as nipa leaves and bamboo for her business.

This is Lita's tenth loan, having successfully paid back all her previous loans and used them to sustain her business activities. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials such as palm leaves and bamboo for her business

loans.name: Jinalyn

texts.en:
Jinalyn is 34 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jinalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jinalyn has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising ducks. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Roger no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios y eso lo imposibilito para no poder estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta remendar redes.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Roger trabaja como pescador artesanal, el tiene un pequeño bote donde realiza sus labores, adicionalmente también se dedica a la construcción de casas maderas, Roger trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su deseo de superación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Roger se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales como mayas, hilo de pescar, pita, sogas y otros, de esta manera Roger podrá seguir remendando sus redes para poder pescar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada construida con materiales resistentes que aseguren el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Roger is a 48 year old man, living in the city of Pucallpa with his spouse and his two children, whom he loves and sees as his main reason for living. He is a friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who together with his spouse devotes all of his efforts to improving life for his family. Regrettably, because of a lack of economic resources and the need to work from a young age to help his parents, Roger could not finish secondary school, which made it impossible for him to pursue a professional degree. In his free time, he likes to mend his nets.

On his own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Roger works as a traditional fisherman. He has a small boat where he does his work. As well, he builds wooden houses. Roger works every day from the early hours of the morning, and often continues for about 12 hours. He enjoys his work and feels that it is a good fit for his desire to improve his life and the friendly way he treats others.

Roger is very grateful for Kiva's small loans, as thanks to the help provided he will be able to purchase materials such as fishing nets, fishing line, ropes, and more. This way, Roger can continue mending his nets to be able to fish, and continue working and pushing himself to achieve his great dream of having a secure home that is well-constructed with solid materials that ensure the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 57 years old and resides at Lilo-an, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rebecca owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she has been in this business for more than 26 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 doing this type of work. 

Recently, she requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to purchase canned goods, bottled products sachet and dairy products for sale.  In the future, Rebecca wants to build a house and finish supporting her child's studies.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, bottled products sachet and dairy products for sale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam, 42 years old, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a restaurant in their village for almost 10 years; in this business she's earning a net income of PHP 500 a day. Due to insufficient capital she's asking for a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to purchase food ingredients, raw meat, and additional materials needed in her restaurant such as plastic cups. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, raw meat, and additional materials needed in her restaurant such as plastic cups.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.en:
Basilio is from the village of Alicia. He is 50 years old and is married. He is thankful because his marriage was blessed with one child. Together with his wife, Basilio manages a sari-sari store (variety store) business to raise his family well. They have been in this business for two years now. 

Basilio is asking a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, condiments, assorted bread, beverages and more stocks of merchandise to sell. He hopes to grow the business well to keep his family's standard of living progressive.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, condiments, assorted bread, beverages and more stocks of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet  is from the village of Tiaman, Bonifacio Misamis Occ. She is 37 years old and married with three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Janet owns and operates a general store or "sari-sari store," selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Janet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase canned goods, rice and corn grits for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, rice and corn grits for sale.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Jessica earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase paints, bamboo, nails, etc for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase paints, bamboo, nails, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Mischeal

texts.en:
Mischeal is a married woman with one child. She is 27 years old and resides in Buracan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Her husband is a dry goods vendor and she helps him to gain income for the family.

Mischeal cultivates fruit trees and harvests their fruit for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000. 

She has requested a new loan of 8,000.00 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to cover the cost of weeding, maintenance and replanting. In the future, she wants to expand the business and use the saved extra income for her child's education.

loans.use: to cover the cost for weeding, maintenance and replanting.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 53 years old and is married to Fernando, a father of three children. Milagros and her family live in the village of Apanay, a simple but peaceful place. 

To earn a living, she manages a general store. She has been in this business for 22 years and usually earns about PHP 300 each day. 

She needs additional capital to further improve her retailing business. To make this possible, she is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy sacks of rice, condiments, noodles, beverages, assorted breads and canned goods. She hopes that she will able to obtain her desired loan to keep improving her sales.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, condiments, noodles, beverage, assorted bread and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
Luy is married and 33 years old. She has a family comprising five members, living together in Moung Ruessei, Battambang province. 

She is a farmer and her business is growing rice and other seasonal crops from which she is able to cover her living costs and provide allowances for her two school-aged children. She has been engaged in this occupation since 2000 with the full support from her spouse.

Right now, she is applying for a loan to build a bathroom along with a latrine inside for her household, since it is very important and can protect their health. This will allow her to improve their quality of life and the environment. 

She is very grateful for the loan program to help poor families improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a bathroom along with a latrine inside for her household.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 45 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Luz has been farming rice for 24 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 35-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

She has been doing embroidery work by machine at home for the past five years to support her family. Her husband is also doing the same work in a firm, but he earns an insufficient income to support his family alone, so he brings some embroidery work home for her. She helps her husband in his work and also sells knitted embroidery in her town. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase a machine for embroidery. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to use a portion of revenue to provide a high-quality education for her children.

Saira is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase tools and supplies for work (hair straightener, shampoo, conditioner, hair treatments, nail polish).

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy is 40 years old, married and a father of three. The family is currently residing at the village of Paniki. 

Billy has a duck raising business to earn more income for his family. He aims to improve his business and increase his income to continue sending his children to college. He plans to raise more ducks to lay eggs for sale, but he lack the necessary materials. 

He is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 14,000 to buy duck feeds, nets, a tray and a tent needed in raising ducks. He believes that someday he will make more improvements in the business as he continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy duck feeds, nets, a tray and a tent for duck raising.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Dimalco Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and married, with three children. 

Teresita plants, harvests and sells corn for a living. She has been in her business for more than 13 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Teresita joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC. Her previous loans helped her to gain abundant harvests and she used the profits for her children's school needs.

Recently, Teresita has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Nuumoa

texts.en: Nuumoa is 56 years old, married, and has five children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as bags of sugar, salt, bags of rice, snacks and canned food. She has been doing this for more than three years. Nuumoa needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sugar, sausages, flour, rice, laundry soap, corned beef in cans, canned fish, lollies (candy), snacks, soft drinks, Vailima brand beer, cigarettes and toilet paper for her business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and also to support her family financially. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, sugar, sausages, flour, rice, laundry soap, corned beef in cans, canned fish, lollies (candy), snacks, soft drinks, Vailima brand beer, cigarettes and toilet paper for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and jewels to paste on clothing.

loans.name: Sanny Grace

texts.en: Sanny Grace lives in Migpane, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, with her husband. She is 21 years old, and she helps her husband to improve their living situation by buying and selling fish in the market. Her husband is a motorcycle transport driver and, in his free time, he fishes to earn additional income. Sanny Grace took out a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to build their house with the earnings she saves for a better living.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 43 years old, married, and has twelve children, four of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Marilyn has been farming rice for 20 years, and she earns additional income from making nipa (palm thatch). She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dellie

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Dellie works hard to support her family. She has a bamboo-weaving business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store and from raising pigs. Dellie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her bamboo-weaving business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her businesses. Dellie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her bamboo-weaving business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: As a widowed parent of five children, Linda works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Linda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business. Linda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Jemelyn

texts.en: Jemelyn is 31 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. Jemelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dry goods to sell. Jemelyn has borrowed and repaid 19 NWTF loans before this loan. She has been running the dry goods business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening and from farming vegetables. Jemelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials, including wood, nails and paint, for her business. Rosario has been in this business for eight years. Rosario earns additional income from a general store. Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, including wood, nails and paint, for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Sartoyo

texts.en:
Sartoyo is a prospective student of Nusantara Maritime Academy who wishes to study marine engineering. Sartoyo lives in a small village, to the west of the town of Cilacap, called Tritih Kulon village. To reach the campus, he  cycles for 1 hour's journey. Although he has to cycle, Sartoyo expects to complete the program of study. 

Sartoyo's parents work as farmers whose income is not fixed. They gather the crops and then sell them and can only meet daily needs, so it is difficult to finance his studies. Sartoyo is willing to work on a ship as a ship technician professional. He also does not want to bother his parents, because his parents are too old to continue work. 

Sartoyo is eager to get a loan from Kiva, to help pay for college expenses, so that he could complete his studies, get a job faster and his parents can be helped in their family economy.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Flamboyan I Group

texts.en:
Flamboyan I group  successfully completed their first cycle with a loan from Kiva and is running smoothly. With that loan in the first cycle, their businesses began to flourish. For this second cycle, there is little change in membership; the number of members is reduced  by 1 and there is also a new member. Currently, the membership is 13 members in the 2nd cycle of Flamboyan i group. 

Besides the same types of business as in the first cycle, selling traditional foods such as egg rolls, 'arem-arem', 'wet pastel' (like empanadas), 'gethuk lindri', branches 'Gesing, nagasari', there is also a business selling clothes. With the loan this time, they will increase the types of food and the types of business of the group members. 

Titi is still the leader of this group, because she can provide encouragement to its members, so that, as in the first cycle, the loan repayment can run smoothly for every member. Titi still has a small business making food such as 'wet pastel', 'dry pastel' and egg rolls. Kiva loans benefit her for this; it is very meaningful to her life with her husband and two children. 

Titi hopes cycle 2 will run smoothly and the group's members' businesses can grow even more. With the loan this time, she will buy the equipment for the production of cakes and pastries.

loans.use: To  buy the equipment for the production of cakes and pastries.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child in school, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal and raising pigs. Wilma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to re-stock her store with different household items like soap, milk, shampoo, noodles, egg, etc. for her general store business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with different household items like soap, milk, shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia, a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a restaurant in the Philippines for 15 years, earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more meat, vegetables, spices and other ingredients for her business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, spices and other ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife, a 40-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for them. The operator of a a general store in the Philippines for 11 years, she sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soap, shampoo, diapers and other groceries. 

Marife has requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto es un hombre de 52, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Humberto no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional Contabilidad que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Tallarín Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Humberto se dedica a la carpintería y tapicería de muebles, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Humberto se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de trabajo, madera, pegamento, clavos y demás materiales, de esta manera Humberto podrá seguir realizando sus labores, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder  brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Humberto, 52, lives in the city of Chiclayo, in Guadalupe district, with his wife and two small children. He loves them and they are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-woring, and enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, puts all his efforts into moving his family forward. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because he had to work to help his parents from the time he was young, Humberto was not able to study the professional degree in Accounting that he wanted. In his free time, he likes to play with his children and sometimes he cooks a delicious Tallarín Saltado (stir-fried noodles) to share with his family.

On his own iniciative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Humberto works in carpentry and the upholstery of furniture. He works every day, from very early in the morning, and he may work about ten hours. He is very comfortable in his work and he believes that it is going well for him because of his good prices and the friendly way he treats others. Humberto is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy materials for work, like wood, glue, nails, and other materials. This way, Humberto will be able to continue with his work. He will keep working and making an effort to achieve his big dream of giving his children an education.

loans.use: to buy materials for his carpentry and upholstery business.

loans.name: Salvadora Del Socorro

texts.es: Salvadora, una joven de 21 años de edad, es soltera con muchas ganas de salir adelante con su carrera de Lic. en Diplomacia y Relaciones Internacionales, el cual ya culmino, pero en la actualidad continua preparándose. Ahora cursa un postgrado en Gerencia y Auditoria, por el momento no trabaja se dedica por completo a sus estudios, su madre la apoya en sus gastos principales. Salvadora solicita el crédito para poder pagar el postgrado.
texts.en: Salvadora, a 21-year-old woman, is single and has a lot of will to move forward with her degree in Diplomacy and International Relations, which she already completed. But right now she continues to study. She is doing postgraduate work in Management and Auditing. For the time being, she is not working and is completely dedicated to her studies. Her mother helps her with her main expenses. Salvadora is seeking a loan to be able to buy for her postgraduate studies.

loans.use: to pay for her postgraduate studies.

loans.name: Deidid

texts.es:
Deidid es una mujer de 60 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Deidid no pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de corte y confección que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta estar en compañía de su hijo.
Por iniciativa propia, Deidid tiene su pequeño negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, ella cuenta con una casa regularmente grande, en la cual alquila habitaciones para estudiantes y trabajadores, todos los días desde tempranas horas ella inicia sus labores de limpieza y aseo de su hogar para mantener en buen estado su vivienda, Deidid trabaja diariamente por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su empeño y dedicación.
Deidi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de estudios y el pago de la matricula de los estudios profesionales de su hijo, ya que este se encuentra estudiando y ella desea apoyarlo, así pues Deidid seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Deidid is 60 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa with her son, whom she loves and is her main motivating force in life. She is a very kind, hard working and enthusiastic person, who has made all efforts to sustain her family, having been both a father and mother figure for her son. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work from a young age to help her parents, Deidid was not able to study dressmaking as she wanted to. She likes to spend her free time with her son.

By her own initiative, Deidid started her own business renting rooms to students and workers in her rather big house. To keep the house in good repair, she starts cleaning it early in the morning, working for approximately 8 hours every day. She thinks she has done well due to her effort and dedication.

Deidi is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since with their support she will be able to buy study materials and pay the college tuition fees for her son. He is studying and she wishes to assist him, and so Deidid will working hard to achieve her dream of seeing her son become a good professional.

loans.use: To buy study materials and pay the tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five daughters and a son. She has been knitting handmade embroidery at her home for 6 years. Four of her daughters also help her to complete her tasks. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw irregularly; he is an irresponsible person and does not care about his children. 

Safia has to prove herself as a responsible and brave mother. In 6 years she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Saira is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins and pearls of various colours.

She wants to take care of her household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Safia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of threads, fancy cloths, sequins and pearls of various colours for embroidery.

loans.name: Glen

texts.en: Glen offers old-fashioned customer service to Austin and the surrounding communities with his private black car and limo chauffeur business, driving clients to and from the airport saying, “I’m my own competition.” Tired of the multiple work-related fees as a former employee of a similar business, Glen decided to work for himself. A seasoned entrepreneur, Glen says he’s always had side projects to accompany his full-time job, but it was his love for cars that intrigued him enough to open a chauffeur business. “Professionally Driven by Glen Private Driver Services” has been in operation for two years and created four part-time jobs in the Austin area. Glen says he would like to hire one more part-time and full-time driver in the near future. However, he is currently looking to secure any upcoming work needed for his cars. After going to BIG Austin, a community-wide business assistance organization, Glen was referred to nonprofit microlender, Accion Texas Inc. He applied and was approved for $5,450. Glen will hold onto the loan in the event that one of his cars needs servicing. He says that knowing he has back-up funds for his business in case of an emergency, he is less stressed. Visit Glen’s website to learn about the types of cars and services he offers at: www.glendrives.com

loans.use: to cover vehicle maintenance work.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 53 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Shirly operates a rice retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell. In the future, Shirly would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.es: El señor Melquiades es soltero, no tiene hijos , vive con su hermano, el señor Melquiades es de la provincia chapare , vino de su comunidad de San Isidro, como la mayoría de las personas buscando mayor oportunidad de vida, en su comunidad se dedicaba a la producción de papa, la producción bajo debido a los cambios climatológicos, los cuales son difíciles de controlar, cada vez la producción escaseo, por lo que decidió migrar  al trópico,  donde se compro el terreno agrícola, en el que hoy en día trabaja en el sector agrícola y se dedica a la producción de piña, de donde tiene en producción 1/2 hectárea de la cual cosecha un promedio de 12,800 unidades  lo que comercializa a los intermediarios que le vienen a comprar al lugar el crédito que está solicitando es para gastos de cosecha de piña.
texts.en: Melquiades is single,  does not have any children and lives with his brother. He is from Chapare Province, but came to San Isidro, like many people do, looking for better opportunities in life. In his town, he used to work growing potatoes, but the production decreased due to climate changes, which are difficult to control, and the harvest became more and more scarce. For this reason, he decided to migrate to a more tropical area, where he bought some farmland which is where he works right now growing pineapples. He has 1/2 a hectare (1 1/4 acres) from which he can harvest around 12,800 units which he sells to intermediaries who come to buy from him. He is requesting a credit to pay for the costs of harvesting the pineapples.

loans.use: to pay the costs of harvesting pineapples.

loans.name: Comadres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COMADRES” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de detergentes, venta de carne, venta de CD’s, venta de coca, servicio de construcción, tienda de abarrotes, venta de calcetines.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que hace veinte años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga de su pueblo que era socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne de vaca; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió desde niña, cuando le ayudaba en el mismo a sus padres, posteriormente cuando se casó decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones porque le enseñan a superarse.
texts.en: The "Comadres" (Mothers) communal bank is requesting its second loan from Pro Mujer (Pro Woman), part of the Centro Focal de Panamerica. The group is made up of nine people and has a board of directors whose president is Victoria. The businesses that the group's members run are varied and include: weaving blankets, selling cleaning products, selling meat, selling CDs, selling coca leaf, construction work, convenience stores, and selling socks. The loan that they are requesting will benefit small entrepreneurs including Victoria. Victoria mentions that she has been part of Pro Mujer for 20 years and was originally invited by a friend from her village to join the group. Currently, she runs a butcher shop selling beef, a trade which she says she has been doing since she was a child when she used to help her parents do the same thing. After she married, she decided to start he own business. The loan that she will take out will be used to increase her products (buying cattle) which she will buy from fairs in the surrounding area and will sell from her own premises. This will allow her to generate income to cover the household expenses for her family, as she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training she receives which teaches her to better herself.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Melis

texts.ru: Мелису 30 лет, женат, имеет 1 сына. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2007 года начал заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Супруга работает в местной школе -поваром. Получает зарплату в 2500 сом (KGS). Мелис начал свою деятельность с 20,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день его хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 7 овец, а также имеет земельный надел 3,0 ГА, где выращивает клевер и озимую пшеницу. Доходы от хозяйства Мелис вложил в сельхоздеятельность. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мелис обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) для покупки теленка. Доходы от кредита Мелис планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота, а также хочет улучшить благосостояние своей семьи.
texts.en: Melis is 30 years old. He is married and has one son. In the search of a source of income for his family, since 2007 he started raising livestock and growing farm produce. His wife works as a cook in a local school, at a monthly salary of 2,500 KGS. Melis launched his business with the starting capital of 20,000 KGS; at present his farm brings in a monthly revenue of 8,000 KGS. He has two dairy cows and seven sheep as well as a land plot of 3 ha [7.4 acres] where he grows clover and winter wheat. Melis has been reinvesting his revenues in his agricultural business. In order to develop his farm further, Melis has applied to the “Bai Tushum & Partners” microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KGS to buy a calf. Melis plans to use his revenues for increasing his livestock and also improving the life conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en: Fortunata lives in Mitan-ag, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental with her family. To earn a living, she owns and helps her husband to operate a corn farm as their main source of income. In 2012 she joined Gata Daku MPC, and it helped her to improve their living situation and ability to engage in business. She borrowed a loan to cover the post-harvest labor costs recently. She plans to cultivate an additional lot to gain more harvest in the next crop. She wants to improve the general living condition of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the post-harvest labor costs

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Doña Angela, es una mujer de edad adulta, con gran trayectoria crediticia en la fundación, para ella su negocio es muy importante porque le da independencia económica y le permite crecer como mujer y como empresaria.
Vive con su esposo adulto mayor y pensionado y dos hijos mayores .
Ella es una persona que tiene gran proyección en la comunidad, apoya a otras mujeres con su compañía en momentos de enfermedad para éstas.
Ella con el crédito podrá  aumentar la línea de productos , atender demanda de meses buenos en ventas. Apoyará gastos de su casa y personalmente le permite realizarse, superarse y tener estabilidad económica, poder vivir más tranquila.
En este momento ella requiere comprar más productos para atender demanda.
texts.en: Angela is a mature woman who has a long credit history with the foundation. Her business is very important to her because it gives her financial independence and allows her to grow as a woman and as a businesswoman. She lives with her husband, who is now retired, and her two adult children. She has a strong presence in the community, and supports other women by keeping them company when they are sick. The loan will help her to increase her merchandise and to respond to customer demand during good months for sales. This will help her to contribute towards the household expenses and, on a personal level, will help her to fulfill herself, better herself and to have financial stability so that she can live more peacefully. Right now, she needs to buy more products to repsond to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy personal grooming products, household items and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, condiments and more to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old and married with four children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Virginia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza 2010 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPERANZA 2010” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, producción de cebiche (comida peruana), venta de verduras, venta de carne de cordero, venta de mandiles, venta de enaguas, costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que hace seis ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por el concejo de un familiar quien le enseño la forma de venta de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de pescado) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Esperanza 2010" ["Hope 2010"] is entering its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer. They are working with one of the organization's regional offices, Panamericana. The group is made up of eight members and is headed by a board of directors. Victoria is the treasurer of the board. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses, including a neighbourhood store, a business making Peruvian ceviche, vegetable sales, lamb sales, apron sales, sales of Bolivian petticoats, and tailoring.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs such as Victoria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six loan cycles ago. She joined the group at the invitation of a consultant from the institution, who came to visit her at her home. Currently, she has a business selling fish. She said that she began this business on the advice of a relative who taught her how to sell this product. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her merchandise by buying fish, which she will acquire wholesale in the markets in the city of El Alto. After that, she will sell it at her place of business. This type of work lets her generate income in order to support her household as best as she can, given that she is single and has a child. 

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training sessions offered.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия в 1996 году закончила Педагогический колледж и с 2000 года она работает в средней школе учительницей. Зулфия имеет 13 летний опыт  в сфере педагогики. Она является одной из успешных учителей, которая имеет свою тематику работы. Она с удовольствием работает и полученную зарплату использует для содержания семьи.Она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Она разведена и сама воспитывает свою дочь. После развода с мужем она живет в родительском доме. Мать Зулфии пенсионерка и отец подрабатывает предоставлением услуги электрика. Дочь Зулфии выходит замуж и до ее свадьбы она планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, песок, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zulfiya has graduated from Teachers College in 1996. Since 2000, she has been working as a secondary school teacher. Zulfiya has 13 years of experience as an educator. She is a successful teacher with her own specialization field. She likes her work and uses her salary to support her family. She has supplementary income from raising livestock. She is divorced and is raising her daughter on her own. After divorcing her husband, she has been living in her parents’ home. Zulfiya’s mother is retired, and her father makes some extra money by working as an electrician. Zulfiya’s daughter is about to get married; before the wedding, Zulfiya plans to renovate her house. Her house is in a bad condition. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 TJS to buy construction materials, such as cement, lumber, sand, paint, etc. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, sand and paint for house renovations.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is married and has two children. She is 52 years old and resides at Poblacion, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

Charlyn owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale, to earn a living. She also buys and sells copra (a coconut product) and charcoal, to earn additional income to improve her family's living situation.

Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 20,000. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for the cultivation of another plot of corn. Charlyn joined GDMPC in 2010. For the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for the cultivation of another plot of corn.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur, who is in a business of buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines. She has been in the peanut business for three years, and she earns additional income from keeping a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional peanuts to sell at her peanut-selling business.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business even more, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional peanuts to sell

loans.name: Daybee

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Daybee works hard to support her family.

She has a business weaving bamboo in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming/selling vegetables. Daybee is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo for her business weaving bamboo.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses weaving and farming/selling vegetables.

Daybee has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo for her business weaving bamboo

loans.name: Enrequita

texts.en:
Enrequita is 61 years old, married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Enrequita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Enrequita has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: José Adelio

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez; aprendió este rubro de su padre quien fue el pionero en enseñar a su hijo a trabajar muy duro para llevar el sustento a su casa. Hoy ya con un hogar propio don José ha podido salir adelante con todos sus compromisos dentro del hogar. Él siente que con su trabajo se puede defender económicamente de acuerdo al tiempo que se vive; pero también se dedica a trabajar en un taller donde es el motorista esto le genera un ingreso extra con el cual puede cubrir todos sus gastos en el hogar.

Los materiales que necesita para su trabajo, así como la comida para su familia los compra en la ciudad mas cercana ubicada a unos 6 kilómetros; pero el transporte es escaso y tiene que esperar por horas a que pase el autobús y de donde lo deja el tiene que caminar hasta su casa 1 kilómetro haciendo esto que el realice un esfuerzo extra para su traslado y el de sus compras.

Don José solicita el crédito para comprar ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro; para elaborar una pila y baño ya que en su casa no tiene estos servicios básicos.

La principal necesidad sera que al construir la pila y el baño tendrá mas privacidad; ademas que si compra todos los materiales de un solo ahorrara un poco ya que le saldrán mas baratos  y el transporte sera mas bajo,así como el precio de los materiales. 

En un futuro, quiere seguir trabajando muy duro para cancelar el crédito y después  hacer mas grande su casa y tener una mejor forma de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and has a partner and two children. He has worked in agriculture since childhood, learning the work from his father who taught his son to work very hard in order to provide for the household. Now with a house of his own José has been able to successfully meet all of his household commitments. He feels that with this work he can get by economically throughout his life, but he also works in a workshop where he is the driver. This gives him an extra income which means he can cover all of his household expenses.

He buys his family's food and the materials he needs for his work in the nearest city some 6 kilometres away. However there is limited transport and he has to wait hours for the bus. From where he gets off the bus he has to walk a kilometre to his house which is hard work when he has to carry his purchases.

José is asking for the loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron in order to put in a bathroom and washbasin, since his house does not have these basic services. The main aim in building the bathroom and basin is to have more privacy. If he buys all of the materials at once he will save some money since they will work out cheaper and similarly the transport will be cheaper. 

His future plans are to carry on working very hard to pay off his loan and later to enlarge his house and have a better way of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron in order to put in a bathroom and washbasin, since his house does not have these basic services.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is 29 years old and married. She has three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, taamu and yams. She can sell her produce in her community, or at the market. She has been doing this for more than five years.

Sera needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, a rake, a pickaxe and some barbed wire. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family, including her children's education .

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, a rake, a pickaxe and some barbed wire

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Meriam works hard to support her family.

She has a business weaving bamboo in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Meriam is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional bamboo to weave for her business weaving bamboo.

Meriam has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Julian Apaza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JULIAN APAZA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Primitiva es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, venta de zapatos de cholita, tejido de macramé, chofer, venta de pescado, venta de comida, venta de mote, elaboración de cebiche (comida peruana).

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Primitiva es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia al observar el amplio mercado de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de frutas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Julian Apaza" is entering its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of one of the organization's regional offices, Panamericana. The group is made of eight members and is headed by a board of directors. Primitiva serves as the secretary of the board. The members of this Communal Bank run a variety of businesses, including fruit sales, selling traditional Bolivian shoes, weaving macrame, working as a chauffeur, fish sales, food sales, grain sales, and making Peruvian ceviche.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs such as Primitiva. She says this is the first time she is working with Pro Mujer, after having joined at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who came to visit her at home. She currently has a business selling fruit. She indicated that she began this business on her own initiative when she saw that there was a large market for this product.

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her merchandise by buying fruit, which she will acquire wholesale in the markets in the city of El Alto. After that, she will make her sales from her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her household, as she is single and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she liked the health benefits.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel lives in Kilifi county in Kenya.  She runs a small grocery store in her neighborhood. She is married and blessed with three children. She is 55 years old and she has been doing this business for the last five years. She knew Milango through friends who buy from her store. She now seeks a loan to buy kales, tomatoes, potatoes and fish. She decided to join so that she could save and be able to access credit so that she can fund her business. She started the business from the savings she had made while in another smaller business. The major challenge that she faces in the running of her business is the price changes and inflation. She has ambitions of owning a retail shop in the next five years to diversify her income. The income that she will raise in the long run will help her start rearing poultry.

loans.use: to buy kales, tomatoes, potatoes and fish.

loans.name: Gauilepapa

texts.en:
Gauilepapa is 52 years old and married with three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, ta'amu (a large root vegetable) and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than five years. 

Gauilepapa needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, file, rake, pickaxe, chemicals, bush knives and taro roots. She has been a member of SBPD for four years now. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family's daily needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, file, rake, pickaxe, chemicals, bush knives and taro roots

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
To generate income, Marilyn engages in selling Kelly Illis Products in her community. She uses her business income to help her husband in financing the education of their four children. She dreams of her children earning college degrees someday. She is working to the best of her ability to meet their needs.

She wants her business to grow more, in order to increase her income. This is the reason why she is asking for additional capital of PHP15,000. She will use the loan to buy more stock of Kelly Illis Products to sell to her customers, like facial wash, face powders, lotions, dish washing liquids, perfumes and other cosmetics. She is hoping that someday, she will make her business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Kelly Illis Products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Poblacion South, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who is in the business of selling ready-to-wear clothes ("RTW") in the Philippines. Liezel has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income by selling prepaid mobile telephone load.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional RTW to sell, to grow her clothing sales business. Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Jenny Beatriz

texts.es:
Jenny es una mujer de 35 años, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando en la escuela fiscal y el tercero aún se queda en casa bajo los cuidados de su madre. Ella es soltera y ha trabajado cada día por salir adelante juntamente con sus hijos. Jenny vive con sus hijos en la Parroquia Chigüilpe a 15 minutos del centro de Santo Domingo la ciudad capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un lugar que  tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa de Ecuador. Esta parroquia tiene varias viviendas de cemento y mixtas de madera con cemento. Tiene un río que es muy visitado y en donde los turistas y habitantes practican varios deportes y además tienen la oportunidad de conocer una cultura tsáchila que suele contar sus leyendas a los visitantes en medio de una fogata y camping. Santo Domingo que es la tercera ciudad más habitada de la región, también contribuye con actividades como la agricultura, ganadería, pesca y manufactura. 
Su negocio está establecido en su casa, todos los días atiende muchos clientes que acuden al bazar y papelería que desde hace 4 años abre las puertas para solventar las necesidades de sus vecinos en cuanto a productos escolares, suministros de oficina, artículos de bazar incluido prendas de vestir, siempre atiende al público con mucho cariño, respeto y amabilidad. Esta actividad comercial la aprendió gracias a su hermana quien con mucha paciencia otorgó a Jenny información sobre proveedores, costos, demanda, etc. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que así también puede dedicar su tiempo a múltiples actividades del hogar, ayudar a sus hijos en las tareas y cuidar a su hijo pequeño. Ahora tiene muchos planes para su negocio entre ellos ampliar el surtido de productos que ofrece comprando al por mayor útiles escolares como cuadernos de diferentes tamaños y modelos, lápices, esferos, etc., todo esto con el afán de que sus clientes encuentren todo lo que necesitan en esta temporada que los niños y jóvenes empiezan un nuevo período de clases, para lo cual decidió buscar a Fundación Alternativa, institución de la cual recibió muy buenas referencias por los créditos y apoyo que brindan a microempresarios y emprendedores. Solicita un crédito que le ayudará en este paso de crecimiento laboral, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio y sus clientes serán más y por lo tanto sus ingresos  crecerán con los cuales podrá ofrecer a sus hijo un mejor estilo de vida. Jenny agradece a cada inversionista de Kiva que decida apoyarle e incentiva a seguir aportando a los emprendedores y microempresarios, ya que es la mejor forma de creer en ellos y sus proyectos, lo cual les motiva a seguir luchando por un mañana mejor.
texts.en:
Jenny, 35, has three children, two of whom are studying at the public school and the third still stays home under her care. She is single and works every day to move forward along with her children. Jenny lives with her children in Chigüilpe parish, 15 minutes from the center of Santo Domingo, the capital city of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province. This place has a very active trade since it has become an inland port of exchange between the mountains and the coast of Ecuador. This parish has many homes made of cement and a combination of wood and cement. There is a much-visited river, where the tourists and inhabitants do a lot of sports. They also have the chance to get to know the Tsáchila culture. Legends are usually told to the visitors during a bonfire and camping. Santo Domingo is the third most populated city in the region. It has activities like agriculture, ranching, fishing, and manufacturing.

Jenny's business is set up in her home. Every day she attends to many customers who come to the bazaar and stationery store that she opened four years ago in order to meet her neighbors needs for school supplies, office supplies, and bazaar goods including articles of clothing. She always attends to the public with a lot of affection, respect, and friendliness. She learned about this commercial activity thanks to her sister, who very patiently gave Jenny information about providers, costs, demand, etc. She really likes what she does since she can also spend her time to several activities in the home, help her children with their homework, and care for her young child. Now she has many plans for her business, among them increasing the number of products that she offers, buying school supplies like notebooks in different sizes and models, pencils, and pens wholesale. This is all so that her customers find every thing that they need at this time of year when children and young people are starting classes again. This is why she decided to seek out Fundación Alternatica, an institution for which she received good references because of the loans and help that they give to micro-business owners and entrepreneurs. She is asking for a loan which will help her in this stage of business growth, since this way she will feel confident in moving forward with her business and she will have more customers. Because of this, her income will increase, and she will be able to offer her children a better lifestyle. 

Jenny thanks each Kiva lender that decides to support her and encourages them to continue contributing to entrepreneurs and micro-business owners, since it is the best way to believe in them and their projects, which motivates them to keep fighting for a better tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for the back-to-school season.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 30 years old, and married to Josephine. They have been blessed with three kids of the following ages:  8, 5, and 3 years old. Michael is in a 'boda-boda' (motorcycle taxi) business. He has been in this business for four years, and right now his monthly income from the business is KES 9000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 90,000. He intends to use the loan to purchase another motorbike. Michael plans to venture into another business with the anticipated profit.This is his third loan from KADET, and he successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ofelia Maribel

texts.es:
Ofelia, se le presenta la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo  porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar jugos, refrescos, sodas, entre otros para ofrecerles a los clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias  ha logrado aportar a la familia con los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Ofelia is in need of a new loan because she requires more operating capital. This investment will help her to buy juices, soft drinks, sodas, and other products to offer to her customers.

Her previous loan helped to strengthen her business. With the profits she earned, she was able to help her family with the household expenses. Her financial condition and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy juices, soft drinks, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock (different types of bread, desserts, and cheese breads).

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es:
Bacilio tiene 29 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, vive en Tarapoto en su casa propia, acompañado de su pareja y de sus 2 hijos. Bacilio, desde muy jovencito se ha dedicado a trabajar, por que siempre ha sido el sustento de su familia, fue junto a su padre que aprendió el oficio de la pintura, lleva más de 10 años desempeñándose en este rubro, el cual le ha permitido que tenga un trabajo estable. Es así que durante muchos años de experiencia pudo tener un negocio estable y ahora con las ganancias que tiene con sus trabajos de pintor, pudo comprar una mototaxi, buscando incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, con el que puede tener un ingreso extra. Este es su primer crédito de Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido  y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
El dinero solicitado de S/.800.00 lo invertirá en la compra de pintura, brochas , lijas , entre otros.
texts.en:
Bacilio is 29 years old and is a hardworking and responsible man. He lives in Tarapoto in his own house with his partner and 2 children. Since being a very young man Bacilio has worked because he has always been the family breadwinner. He learnt the trade of being a painter with his father and has been doing this for more than 10 years. This has made it possible for him to have stable work. During his many years' experience he has been able to have a stable business and now with the profits he makes from working as a painter he has been able to buy a mototaxi, with which he can earn an extra income. He is aiming to increase his income to improve his family's quality of life.

This is his first loan with Kiva and he is very grateful for the financial support he has received and promises to be punctual with his repayments. He will spend the 800 soles he has asked for to buy paint, paintbrushes, sandpaper and other items.

loans.use: to buy paint, paintbrushes, sandpaper and other items.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is 45 years old and married. She has four children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, taamu and yams. She can sell these in her community, or at the market. She has been doing this for more than five years.

Mareta needs a loan to buy digging stick, barbed wire, bush knives, chemicals, taro roots, fertilizer, rake, pick and file. She has been a member of SBPD since 2008. She will use the profits from her sales to upgrade her family's standard of living and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy digging stick, barbed wire, bush knives, chemicals, taro roots, fertilizer, rake, pick and file

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 44 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy additional stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, milk, coffee, eggs, and noodles. Susana has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF, before this loan. 

Susana aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, milk, and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Isla Trinitaria en Guayaquil.  Empezó en esta actividad debido a que su esposo no encontraba trabajao, por ende, tenía que ayudar en las finanzas a su esposo.  Trabaja todos los días con él, de 8 am a 2 pm y de 6 a 10 pm.  Tienen un hijo de 21 años y usa una silla de ruedas.  Su esposo la ayuda también cuando ella tiene que realizar alguna labor fuera de casa, como de empleada doméstica.  Tienen 2 hijos.  Necesita el dinero para invertir en la comida y adecuación de su local.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in the District of Isla Trinitaria in Guayaquil. She started this business because her husband was not able to find work. For this reason, she had to help her husband with the finances. She and her husband work every day from 8:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M., and from 6:00 P.M. to 10:00 P.M. They have a 21-year-old son who uses a wheelchair.

The borrower’s husband helps out whenever she must work outside of the home at her job as a domestic employee. They have two children. She needs the money to invest in food and renovations to her establishment.

loans.use: to buy food supplies and to pay for renovations to her establishment.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es: Johnny tiene cincuenta y seis (56) años de edad, vive en la famosa ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del Atlántico, nacionalmente conocida como “Curramba la Bella”. Reside con su conyugue y tres (3) hijos, dos (2) varones de veintiuno (21) y veintidós (22) años de edad, y una joven de escasos quince (15) años de edad. Su negocio consiste en prestar el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras a clientes que viven en su barrio y barrios circunvecinos, quienes le solicitan el servicio por teléfono; el servicio de arriendo de las lavadoras lo presta todos los días de seis (6) de la mañana a siete (7) de la noche, cobra el servicio por horas, y le pagan de contado. Desde hace cinco (5) años inició su negocio, por sugerencia de un familiar que le recomendó emprenderlo; comenzó con dos (2) lavadoras, y como el negocio funcionó, se fue haciendo a más lavadoras, hoy en día cuenta con doce (12). Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de cinco (5) nuevas lavadoras, con el objetivo de ampliar su servicio a mayor cantidad de clientes, aumentar sus ingresos, utilidades, y poder hacer ahorros. Uno de sus anhelos es de adquirir una casa propia para su familia.
texts.en:
Johnny is 56 years old and lives in the famous city of Barranquilla, in the region of Atlántico, known around the country as "Curramba la Bella". He lives with his partner and their three children, two young men of 21 and 22 years old, and one young lady of only 15 years old.

His business involves renting out washing machines to customers in his neighbourhood and in nearby communities, who call him to request this service. He offers the rental service every day from six in the morning to seven at night. He charges for this service by the hour, and he receives payments in cash.

He started this business five years ago, at the recommendation of a relative. He started with two washing machines, and since the business was working, he began to accumulate more washers. Today he has twelve.

This is his first loan with Kiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will use it to buy five new washing machines, with the goal of offering his services to a greater number of customers, increasing his earnings and profits, and to have some savings. One of his dreams is for him and his family to have their own home.

loans.use: to buy five new washing machines, with the goal of providing his services to more customers.

loans.name: Denia Sorayda

texts.es: Denia,  tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Choloma. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y productos de cosméticos. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa desde hace 5 años. Ofrece ropa para damas, lociones, cremas, jabón líquidos etc. El préstamo que Denia solicito es por L.10, 000 el cual lo utilizara para surtir el negocio de mercadería  como ropa, lociones, cremas, jabón etc. Para mantener surtido el negocio. Su meta es crecer con el negocio y en lo personal quiere continuar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Denia is 32 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the town of Choloma.

Denia has a business of selling clothing and cosmetics. Her business is located in her house and has been in operation for five years. She offers clothing for women, lotions, crèmes, liquid soaps, and other products. Denia is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL so that she can restock her business with merchandise such as clothing, lotions, crèmes, soaps, and other products so that she can maintain the inventory of her business. Her goal is to grow her business. On a personal level, she wants to continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing, lotions, crèmes, soaps, and other products to restock her business.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 29 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en la casa de sus suegros. Silvia tiene su actividad laboral orientada al área de la diversión y el esparcimiento. Tiene una discoteca que ha construido en su casa y en el que recibe a su público todos los fines de semana para que pasen un buen momento de relajo. Su ganancia económica se basa principalmente en el consumo que sus clientes realizan dentro del local, para ello ofrece a la venta diversos tipos de bebidas como cervezas, gaseosas y ciertos bocaditos para hacer más amena su estancia en el lugar. Complementa su trabajo brindando una agradable atención, buena música y un ambiente confortable, características que también le permiten alquilar su local en días particulares para eventos institucionales o privados. Lleva con este negocio más de 7 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre tiene buena rentabilidad y eso le da la tranquilidad que necesita para brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 4000 soles y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá totalmente en la compra de gaseosas y golosinas para tener su local abastecido con estos productos.
texts.en:
29 year old Silvia is married and has 2 children who she lives with in her in-laws' home. Silvia works in the field of fun and recreation. She has a discotheque that she built in her house and she opens it to the public ever weekend so that they can have a moment of relaxation. Her income comes mainly from the refreshments that her customers buy while they are here. She offers various types of drinks such as beer and soda and snacks that makes people's time there more enjoyable. She offers friendly service, good music, and a comfortable environment, and these characteristics enable her to also rent her establishment for institutional and private events. She has been running this business for 7 years and her husband helps her with this work. What she likes about her work is that it is always profitable and this gives her the security she needs to offer her family what they need. 
At this time, she is requesting $1,450 and is very grateful for the financial support that she has received so she can get ahead and she promises to make her repayments punctually. The loan she is requesting will all be used to buy sodas and candy to supply her premises with these products.

loans.use: to buy sodas and candy.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Life difficulties have encouraged Sofia and her husband to engage in a hog-raising business. Sofia aims to become successful and financially stable in this type of livelihood, in the future. She is married at 19 years old. At a young age, she has realized that engaging in this simple business will give a comfortable living to their future children. They live happily in a rural community, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. The crops are also maintained by her husband.

To maintain their hog-raising business's needs, Sofia is asking for additional capital from lenders amounting to PHP10,000. She will use it in buying feed, vitamins, and additional piglets that she will raise. She is working hard to make her business grow, and somehow make it become their family's sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets that she will raise

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Sonia works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by keeping a general store.

Sonia is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.
