Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional food ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Juana Argentina

texts.es: Juana de 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija, tuvo dificultades para continuar sus estudios pero aun con obstáculos hoy en día está en la etapa final de su carrera de Lic. en Química y Farmacia profesión que le gusta mucho y la llena de ilusión ejercerla, esto gracias al apoyo económico de su familia, ya que Juana no tiene empleo actualmente. Ella solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación, para culminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Juana is 33 years old and a single mother with one daughter. Even though she has had difficulties with continuing her studies, she is now in the final stage of obtaining her degree in Chemistry and Pharmacology. She enjoys this profession very much and would like to pursue it full-time.

Juana is thankful for the financial support of her family since she is currently unemployed. She is requesting a loan so that she can pay for a course that is needed to complete her degree.

loans.use: to pay for a course in her degree program.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 73 years old and married to Susan. They have been blessed with four children. He sells goats and cows, a business he started three years ago, and he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has requested a third loan of KES 50,000. He will use this loan to purchase more cows and goats for resale. The profit he earns will aid him to expand this business. He hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: To purchase cows and goats for later sale.

loans.name: Riya

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Riya works hard to support her family.

She has a bamboo stick business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Riya is borrowing 12000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional bamboo to sell.

Riya has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 48 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos. Vive desde hace 18 años en la misma localidad. El trabajo al que se dedica es dar mantenimiento a un rancho de playa, dicha actividad la ejerce con mucho gusto.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cubrir los gastos de estudios de una de sus hijas la cual se encuentra ya en la fase final de su carrera universitaria y tiene que realizar una serie de gastos para efecto de poder graduarse. Debido a múltiples gastos que tiene se le  hace imposible el cubrirlos.  

Con el crédito podrá cubrir la imperante necesidad de ayudar a una de sus hijas a terminara la carrera y así ella podrá incorporarse activamente a la vida laboral y llevar ingresos a la familia. 

Si bien es cierto, no tendrá el beneficio de forma directa tendrá la satisfacción de ver a su hija realizada. A futuro tiene la meta de obtener un crédito para comprar su equipo de pesca, ya que tiene tiempo para ejercer esa profesión y obtener ingresos extras para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Él también tiene como meta sacar a sus hijos adelante en base a tener una buena educación y él manifestó que es el mejor legado o herencia que le puede dar a sus hijos para que sean personas de provecho.
texts.en:
Manuel is 48 years old and is the farther of two children. He has lived in the same place for 18 years. He works maintaining an area of beach, and he does this with great pleasure. 
The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to cover the cost of educating one of his daughters who is in the final phase of her university degree and needs to make a series of payments so that she can graduate. Due to multiple expenses that she has, she is not able to cover these fees.
With the loan, he will be able to meet this pressing need to help one of his daughters to finish her degree and, in this way, she will be able to enter the world of work and bring income to the family.
It is true that Manuel will not benefit directly, but he will have the satisfaction of seeing his daughter graduate. In the future, he has the goal of getting a loan to buy some fishing equipment as he has time to follow this profession and bring-in extra income to cover the family expenses. He also has the goal of helping his children to succeed through good education and he says that it is the best legacy or inheritance that you can give to your children so that they will have advantages in life.

loans.use: to cover the cost of educating one of his daughters who is in the final phase of her university course and has to make a series of payments so that she can graduate.

loans.name: Glenda Estela

texts.es: Glenda es una mujer microempresaria de 45 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, su negocio es la elaboracion y  venta de artesanía desde hace 10 años, sus productos los comercializa en  diferentes lugares del país. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de productos como barro, leñas en rajas, pinturas acuarelas, brochas, brillo,para la fabricacion de  jarrones, figuras de pared, chinos, etc.
texts.en:
Glenda is a female entrepreneur who is 45 years old, married, and has one young child. She has been in the business of making and selling handicrafts for 10 years. Her products are sold in different parts of the country.

Her loan will be invested in raw materials for making her products such as clay, chopped firewood, watercolors, brushes, and glitter for making vases, wall decorations, dishes, and other items.

loans.use: to buy clay, chopped firewood, watercolors, brushes, and glitter.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en: Nickson, 30, is a single man. He lives in Kilifi County, where he owns a small pharmacy. He has been selling medicine and drugs for more than two years now. He started the business out of his own savings. He heard of Milango from friends and he decided to join so that he could access credit to fund his venture. He now seeks a loan to buy more medicine and drugs. The main challenge that he faces in the business is finding clients. He has ambitions of owning more than four shops in five years time. For now, he will reinvest the income that he raises from the business back into the business to make it more stable.

loans.use: to buy more medicine and drugs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a printer, computer, scanner,  laminating machine and printing paper.

loans.name: Farides Del Carmen

texts.es: Farides tiene cuarenta y nueve (49) años de edad, vive en el corregimiento de Salgar, municipio de Puerto Colombia, departamento del Atlántico, a orillas del Mar Caribe; población ubicada en una zona turística del departamento. Reside con su conyugue, con el cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres (3) mujeres de 22, 26 y 28 años de edad, y un (1) varón de 21 años de edad. Tiene como negocio una miscelánea donde vende cremas, desodorantes, accesorios femeninos,  artículos de papelería entre otros, y un restaurante donde expende comidas típicas de la región y refrescos. Todos los días abre su negocio de seis (6) de la mañana a seis (6) de la tarde, vende solo de contado. Compra todos los productos de la miscelánea y los insumos para la elaboración de los alimentos del restaurante en el mercado central de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Desde el mes de enero de 2005, es decir, hace ocho (8) años, inició el negocio del restaurante, por una sugerencia de una de sus hijas, quien le recomendó que vendiera comidas frente a la iglesia del corregimiento, al poco tiempo abrió en su casa el negocio de la miscelánea, ambas ideas han sido exitosas. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra al por mayor de viveres para el restaurante y mercancía variada para la miscelánea, con el objetivo de obtener mejores precios y descuentos. Sus metas son: Seguir ampliando el restaurante, y la miscelánea, aumentar las ventas y las utilidades, y poder terminar de remodelar la vivienda.
texts.en: Farides is 49 years old and lives in the Salgar area in the town of Puerto Colombia in the Atlántico department, on the shore of the Caribbean sea. This is a tourist zone. She lives with her spouse with whom she has 4 kids, 3 girls who are 22, 26, and 28 years old, and 1 boy who is 21 years old. She has a general store where she sells creams, deodorants, feminine products, stationary, and other goods, and a restaurant where she sells local dishes and refreshments. Every day, she opens her business at 6 in the morning and closes it at 6 at night, and she only sells for cash. She buys all her store supplies and supplies for making the dishes for the restaurant in the central market in the city of Barranquilla. She began this restaurant business in January 2005 (that is to say, 8 years ago) on the suggestion of one of her daughters who recommended that she sell food in front of the church. After a little time, she opened the store in her house and both ideas have been successful. This is her first Kiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to buy foodstuffs for the restaurant wholesale and goods for the general store with the goal of getting better prices and discounts. Her goals are: to keep growing her restaurant and the store, to increase her sales and profitability, and to finish remodeling her home.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs wholesale for the restaurant and varied goods for the general store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 41 años, está casado con Silveria y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Juan se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de productos regionales como plátano, arroz, yuca y otros. Su plantación principal esta conformada por diversas variedades de plátano las mismas que son de mayor demanda entre la población, sus productos son vendidos en el puerto fluvial que se encuentra ubicado a poca distancia de su terreno agrícola. Lleva 10 años trabajando en este negocio y aún recuerda que al principio padeció mucho para establecerlo ya que necesitaba de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, sin embargo siguió adelante y pudo lograrlo. Asegura que es mucho mejor trabajar de manera independiente que hacerlo bajo la autoridad de otras personas como lo hacia antes ya que asegura que terminaba demasiado cansado. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles y está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará abono orgánico y semillas de plátano para continuar con la siembra.
texts.en: 41 year old Juan is married to Silveria and has 3 children who she lives with in their own home. Juan works in agriculture, specifically growing regional produce such as banana, rice, yucca, and others. His main plantation is planted with different varieties of banana, those that are most in demand by the people. He sells his produce in the river port which is located a short distance from his land. He has been doing this work for 10 years and still remembers that, in the beginning, he suffered a lot to get established and it took a lot of effort and work. However, he kept going and was able to achieve his goals. He says that is is best by far to work independently than to work for other people as he did before as he used to be too tired. On this occasion, he is requesting $550 dollars and he is very happy to know that he will have financial support that will enable him to succeed. He also promises to make his repayments punctually. He will use the amount he is requesting to buy organic fertilizer and banana seeds to continue his planting.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and banana seeds.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a hardworking entrepreneur, has been a meat dealer in the Philippines for 25 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Sarah, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF, is requesting a new loan of PHP 29500 to buy additional meat to sell. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional meat to sell

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos Tiene veinticuatro (24) años de edad, vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, población que se encuentra ubicada a orillas del Mar Caribe, región turística del departamento del Atlántico. Reside con su conyugue y dos (2) niñas de seis (6) y ocho (8) años de edad. Su negocio consiste en la comercialización de artículos como jeans, camisas, calzados, celulares, colonias, y perfumes, los cuales los vende a crédito a amigos, vecinos, y referidos. Todos los días de siete (7) de la mañana a siete (7) de la noche ejerce su labor de comerciante. Compra de contado a distribuidores mayoristas. Desde marzo de 2010, es decir, hace tres (3) años, inició su negocio, ayudando a su esposa a vender productos por catalogos, luego los clientes le sugirieron o solicitaron que vendiera otros productos, por lo que se lanzó a vender los productos de su negocio. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de jeans, camisas, calzados, colonias, y perfumes que le han solicitado sus clientes. Con esto espera aumentar su volumen de ventas y utilidades. Tiene como metas: Abrir al público un almacen de variedades, y comprar una casa propia para su familia.
texts.en: Carlos is 24 years old and lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, which is located on the shores of the Caribbean. This is a tourist area in the Atlántico department. He lives with his spouse and 2 children who are 6 and 8 years old. His business is selling articles such as jeans, shirts, footwear, cell phones, and perfumes, which he sells on credit to friends, neighbors, and people who are referred to him. He works everyday from 7 in the morning until 7 at night. He buys from major distributors for cash. He began this business in March 2010 (that is to say, 3 years ago), helping his wife to sell products from a catalog. Later, their customers suggested or requested that they sell other products, and so he began to sell goods from his store. This is his first Kiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy jeans, shirts, footwear, and perfumes that his customers have requested. With this, he hopes to increase the volume of sales and their profitability. His goals are: to open a general store and to buy a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, shoes, and perfumes that his customers have requested.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
Kouser is a 57-year-old, married woman, residing in the town of Lahore, Pakistan. She has a husband, four daughters, and two sons. Her husband is involved in a tailoring business, in which he provides services of stitching clothes for his customers. He is very expert in his profession, and people like his stitched clothes a lot.

Kouser's husband has hired a new worker for his shop, due to the burden of work. He needs a sewing machine for the new worker's use. Kouser requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy the new machine for his employee's use. Kousar hopes that the new worker will work efficiently, and this will cause an increase in her family's income, and their savings, as well.

Kouser is very glad after taking this loan, and very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for use by her husband's new employee, at the tailoring shop

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking mother who owns and manages a variety store to supplement her husband's income. She is 47 years old and blessed with two children. She is a responsible mother aiming for her family to become financially stable in order to sustain their necessities and give their children bright futures. 

In this connection, Elena is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of food snacks, canned goods, rice, frozen foods, beverages, and seasonings to sell. Despite the problems and difficulties in life, she is hoping that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, rice, frozen foods, beverages, and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred, a 26-year-old, married father of one, supports his family by operating a retail store. He is from Thika, in Kenya. His main challenge in business is insufficient capital to keep the store well-stocked. Because of this, he has been unable to attract more customers and expand the business. He needs to make his store more profitable, so he can improve living conditions for his family. 

Alfred earns a monthly income of KES 15,500, which he uses to support his family. A loan from KADET will allow Alfred to purchase rice, cooking oil and sugar for his store. With the additional income he will earn from the sale of these products, he plans to reinvest in the business. He wants to be able to continue to support the education of his one child, through college. 

In the future, he hopes to expand his business to become a larger general store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil and sugar, to resell at his store

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati lives in Kilifi county. She is 41 years old and she is married. She runs a motorcycle transport business. This has been her core business for the last five years and she started the business from her own savings. The challenges that she faces in the business are the high costs of fuel and the weather. She is planning to venture into a charcoal-selling business. 

She knew about Milango through adverts and she inquired about it; that's how she joined. She now seeks a loan to buy bags of charcoal to start this new venture. In the next five years she wants to own several businesses that will be stable on their own.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lizeth Margarita

texts.es:
Lizeth es una mujer de 46 años de edad la cual es casada, amada de casa y madre de 5 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos viven bajo su mismo techo y las 2 mayores ya están casadas y en hogares aparte. Con un grado de educación primaria no completado ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy temprana edad. La tierra que ella en compañía de su esposo trabaja es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está ubicada a 10 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual ella podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, fungicidas, herbicidas para sus cultivos de café y darles la protección que necesita para obtener una buena cosecha. 

Sus planes para el futuro son los de poder comprar una variedad de semilla la cual se de mejor calidad y más atractiva para el mercado local y nacional como: caturra, borbone, lempira. Etc. ya que de esa manera ella podrá obtener mejores ingresos para su familia y podrá apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios ya que es su primera prioridad.
texts.en:
Lizeth is a 46-year-old woman who is a married homemaker and the mother of five children.  Three of them live under her roof while the two eldest are already married with their own homes.  She has an incomplete primary education and she has worked in farming for many years now as her parents taught her to work the land from a very young age.  She owns the land she works with her husband thanks to an inheritance from her parents; it is located 10 km from her home and she gets there on foot.

She has asked the COMIXMUL cooperative for financing to buy fertilizers, manure, fungicides, and herbicides for her coffee crops to give them the protection they need to produce a good harvest.

Her plans for the future are to be able to buy a different varietal of seed that is of better quality and is more attractive in the local and national markets, such as caturra, borbone, lemira, etc.  This will allow her to make more profits for her family and she will be able to pay for her children's education, which is her top priority.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for her coffee crops

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and has two children. She is 36 years old and resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Gloria has a business venture, selling seafood products to the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. Her husband is a fishermen and she helped him to earn an income with her buy-and-sell business.

Recently, she requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase a new set of fishing nets.  In the future, she wants to improve their house and to help complete her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of fishing nets

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Redempter

texts.en:
Redempter, a married mother of four from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Munyiri, who is a mason. She also runs a kiosk to supplement her income. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her third loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loans successfully. With the most recent loan she has applied for from KADET LTD, she will be able to purchase poultry feed and a dairy cow. The additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family and also restock her kiosk. In the future, Redempter would like to buy more dairy cows. 

She hopes to save money to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and a dairy cow

loans.name: Ecelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ecelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a meat-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ecelyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell for her meat-vending business.

Ecelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchse additional meat to sell

loans.name: María Soraida

texts.es: María ha solicitado por segunda ocasión un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa, por varias circunstancias ajenas a su voluntad le ha sido imposible asistir a las capacitaciones que han dictado allí, sin embargo la asesoría personalizada que le han brindado le ha ayudado mucho para llevar una buena administración de su negocio, el cual, cada día va creciendo más. Luego de fortalecer su plantación de plátanos, María ha adquirido la suficiente experiencia para ampliar las plantaciones en su terreno e incursionar con un nuevo producto y muy demandado como es el cacao, por lo cual esta vez su inversión será en la compra de semillas, abono e insumos para cultivar este fruto que al igual que todos necesita ciertos cuidados para producir un fruto de calidad. Con esta inversión sus ingresos mejorarán y ella podrá replanificar sus gastos, pues un cuarto bebé viene en camino y es absolutamente necesario que él tenga las mismas oportunidades que sus hemanos de estudiar y crecer en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: María is asking Fundación Alternativa for a second loan.  Due to circumstances out of her control, it was not possible for her to attend the training sessions they offer.  However, the personal consultation they gave her has helped her a great deal in managing her business, which is growing every day.  After strengthening her banana crops, María has acquired sufficient experience to expand planting on her land and to start out with a new and in-demand crop, cacao.  That is why this time she will invest in seed, fertilizer, and supplies to grow this plant, which like all others needs care to produce quality fruit.  This loan will improve her income and she will be able to re-plan her expenses, as she has a fourth baby on the way and it is absolutely necessary that he have the same opportunities as his siblings have had to study and to grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and supplies to plant cacao

loans.name: Linda

texts.es: Linda, de 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Linda se dedica a la agricultura, para eso cuenta con un terreno de 2 hectáreas. Se dedica principalmente a la siembra de plátano aunque lo complementa con otros cultivos como cacao y cocona. La cosecha de plátano lo realiza periódicamente para venderlos por racimos al por mayor en los mercados más cercanos. Por la lejanía de su parcela de trabajo no puede estar permanentemente sin alejarse del mismo, es por eso que pasa largos días fuera de su hogar hasta obtener una buena producción que cosecha con mucho esmero con ayuda de su esposo y de un trabajador más. Adicionalmente cría animales para su posterior venta como aves y cerdos. Le gusta su actividad  ya que lleva años en este negocio y eso le ha permitido mantener a su familia, también comenta que le gusta la vida de campo donde se siente más tranquila y ahí pone en práctica todo lo que aprendió de sus padres quienes también eran agricultores. Por otro lado manifiesta sus deseos de seguir creciendo e incrementar su área de siembra de plátano. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 4000, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo, además se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de  todas sus cuotas. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico y contratar más trabajadores para la temporada de cosecha.
texts.en: Linda, 30 years old, is married and has three children with whom she lives in her own home. Linda is a farmer, and she has two hectares of land. She mainly plants plantains, but she complements this with other crops such as cacao and cocona. She harvests the plantains periodically to sell by the bunch wholesale in the most nearby markets. Because her land is so far away, she can't stay there permanently without moving. This is why she spends long days away from her home until she gets a good product that she harvests with great care, with the help of her husband and one other worker. She also raises animals to sell such as birds and pigs. She likes her work; she has years of experience in this business, and this has allowed her to support her family. She also says that she likes life on the farm, where she feels most peaceful and can put into practice everything she learned from her parents, who were also farmers. On the other hand, her goals are to continue growing and to increase the amount of land she has for planting plantains. For this opportunity, she is requesting S/. 4,000. She is happy with the financial support given so that she can move forward with her work. She promises to make her payments on time. She will invest the money in purchasing organic compost and hiring more workers for harvest time.

loans.use: purchase organic compost and hire workers.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is a married, 28-year-old mother of two in Mwingi. Lena has been running a grocery store for the past eight years with a monthly income of 10,000 KS (Kenyan shillings), which she uses to support her family. 

Lena is applying for her sixth loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to purchase two bags of potatoes costing 8,000 KES, three bags of onions at 16,000 KES and two crates of tomatoes at 6,000 KES. She will use the additional income to repay her loan and improve the standard of living of her family. 

She hopes to open a cosmetics shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of potatoes costing 8,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), three bags of onions at 16,000 KES and two crates of tomatoes at 6,000 KES.

loans.name: Rosa Paula

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal República Del Ecuador se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, con ella vive uno de ellos así como también una nieta que tiene 10 años y estudia en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Doña Rosa para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que con lo que él gana no alcanza para cubrir los gastos, hace mas de 12 años empezó un negocio, ella se dedica a preparar bocadillos y alimentos en su casa, los mismos que son para eventos, fiestas y recepciones de personas o instituciones. Ella trabaja sola en la preparación de los alimentos y cuando tiene mucho que hacer una hermana le ayuda pero en la entrega si le ayudan su hijo y su esposo si él está libre. Gracias a esto ellos salen adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pollo y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The República Del Ecuador Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year-round. It is also known for being a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.
Rosa lives in this area. She is 52, married, and has five grown children, one of whom lives with her. She also has a 10-year-old granddaughter who is in school. Her husband is a security guard.
In order to help her husband with the household costs because he does not earn enough to cover them, Rosa started a business over 12 years ago. She prepares sandwiches and other foods in her home for events, parties, and receptions for private individuals or companies. She prepares the food alone, but when she has a lot to do one of her sisters helps her. Her son and husband help her to deliver the food if they are free. Thanks to this business, they are getting ahead; her husband does not make much money.
Rosa will use this loan to buy rice, meat, chicken, and other groceries for preparing her food. She has been part of the Communal Bank from the beginning, and she likes it because the loans are helpful.
Her dream is to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, chicken, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Eulalia Verónica

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal República Del Ecuador se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Eulalia, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16  y 14  años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Eulalia junto al esposo tienen una tienda de víveres en un mercado de Manta, hace cuatro años arrendaron un local en el cual venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, allí ella y su marido pasan todo el día atendiendo a los clientes que cada día llegan hasta su local a abastecerse de los alimentos. Gracias a los créditos ellos han podido mejorar mucho su local y con cada crédito ellos surten mas su tienda ya que esta es su fuente de ingresos y lo que les permite salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos mejoran cada día más. 

Su sueño es tener un local propio para no pagar arriendos que se le llevan buena parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The República Del Ecuador Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round, as well as for being a city of incomparable beauty with many tourist attractions. 

This is where Eulalia lives.  She is 42 years old, married, and has two children who are 16 and 14 and who are in school.  Her husband is a businessman.

Together with her husband, Eulalia has a food store in the city of Manta.  Four years ago they rented a space where they sell all kinds of necessities, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, beans, vegetables, and fruits.  They work every day from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm.  She and her husband spend the whole day serving the customers who come to their store daily to stock up on food.  Thanks to the loans they have been able to improve their store a great deal and with each loan they stock their store more, as this is their source of income and it is what allows them to get ahead. 

She will use this loan to stock her store more.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, canned goods, and other necessity items.  She has been with the communal bank from the outset and she likes it because thanks to the loans they get better every day.

Her dream is to have her own location so she will not have to pay rent, which takes a good portion of her profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, canned goods, and other necessity items

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Nena works hard to support her family.

She has a detergent retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Nena is borrowing 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more detergent stock to sell.

loans.name: Yexi Maribel

texts.es:
Yexi tiene 20 años, es una joven microempresaria que tiene el estado civil de unión libre con su cónyuge Cristian de 19 años y que es un joven chofer profesional y trabaja en una compañía de taxis. Tienen un hijo pequeño y viven juntos en la parroquia Abrahan Calazacón en Santo Domingo la ciudad capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un lugar que  tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa de Ecuador. Además la visita de turistas nacionales y extranjeros aporta al fortalecimiento de las actividades de los emprendedores que desde hace algunos años han establecido sus negocios alrededor de toda la ciudad. Esta ciudad que es la tercera más habitada de la región, también contribuye con actividades como la agricultura, ganadería, pesca y manufactura. 
Yexi desde hace 3 años emprendió con el establecimiento de un salón de belleza, pues durante el curso de su secundaria, se especializó en esta rama artesanal la cual disfruta mucho y además cada vez la perfecciona más con cursos que hace en diferentes casas de belleza. Invierte 12 horas cada día incluidos los fines de semana, descansa cuando la demanda del servicio es baja. Su sueño es poder ampliar su salón de belleza con servicios de spa incluidos y así poder dar trabajo a otras personas. Ella solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará en la compra de muebles adecuados para su negocio, sillas en las que pueda brindar confort a sus clientes y también con los que ella pueda desempeñar cómodamente su trabajo, además sillas para atender a niños y muebles para la sala de espera. Yexi cada día incrementa sus clientes por lo que se proyecta a crecer cada día más para el bienestar de su familia. Fundación Alternativa ha sido la institución que le abrió las puertas para poder dar ese cambio que necesita su negocio.
texts.en:
Yexi is 20. She is a young businessperson and is in a common-law marriage with Cristian, 19, who is a young professional driver and works for a taxi company. They have a small child and live together in the Abrahan Calazacón parish in Santo Domingo, the capital city of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Commerce is quite strong in the area, since it is a land port of exchange between the mountains and the coast of Ecuador. Visits from local and international tourists strengthen the local businesses, which have recently grown up all around the city. This is the third-most inhabited city in the region. The residents also work in areas such as agriculture, livestock, fishing, and manufacturing.
Yexi opened a beauty salon three years ago. She specialized in this art in high school, and enjoys it greatly. She is constantly honing her skills through courses at various beauty centres. She works twelve hours a day, every day, including weekends. She rests when there is lower demand for her services. Her dream is to be able to expand her beauty salon with spa services in order to be able to provide work for other people. 
Yexi is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase adequate furniture for her business. She will buy chairs, both to provide her clients with comfort and to allow her to work comfortably. She will also buy chairs for children and furniture for the waiting room. Her clientele grows every day; she expands her business every day for the sake of her family's well-being. Fundación Alternativa opened its doors to her so that she could make this needed change to her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon furniture.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 34 years old and married with an only child. Her husband worked as a jeepney driver providing transportation in the community. She helps him operate their own rice production business.  

In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pay for weeding maintenance costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is single, 41 years old and a mother of two in Mwingi. Agnes has been running a grocery store for the past fifteen years with a monthly income of about KES 14,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Agnes is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after she was introduced by an existing KADET client. Agnes intends to use the loan to purchase 2 bags of potatoes costing KES 8,000, 2 bags of onions costing KES 13,000, 2 bags of avocados at KES 4,000, and 1 crate of tomatoes at KES 5,000. She will use the additional income to repay her loan and improve the standard of living of her family. 

Agnes hopes to educate her children to college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of potatoes, 2 bags of onions, 2 bags of avocados, and 1 crate of tomatoes.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 51 years old and widowed with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, chips, noodles, etc.

She has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Marilou aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, chips, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Maira

texts.en:
Maira is 40 years old and married with three children.

Maira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc.

Maira has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Maira aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Omar, quien con su credikiva pudo invertir en la compra de productos de aseo personal (desodorantes, talcos, otros), y productos capilares (champú, tintes, acondicionadores, cremas de peinar, otros). Con esta inversión pudo aumentar su capital de trabajo al poder surtir el negocio con más productos, fortaleciendo algunas líneas especificas, trayendo un mayor volumen de ventas, haciendo crecer su negocio. Con este progreso a podido seguir apoyando a sus hijos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito para invertir en productos para la belleza, aseo personal y productos capilares. Omar dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias al programa de Kiva se ha podido consolidar mi negocio”
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Omar, who, with his Kiva loan, was able to invest in the purchase of personal products (deodorants, talcs, etc.) and hair products (shampoo, tints, conditioners, dyes, etc.) With this investment, he was able to increase his working capital to be able to stock his business with more products, expanding certain lines, bringing in more sales, and growing his business. With this progress, he has been able to continue supporting his children. Currently, he is requesting a new loan to invest in beauty products, personal products, and hair products. Omar tells his lenders: "Thanks to Kiva, I have been able to strengthen my business."

loans.use: invest in beauty products, personal hygiene products, and hair products.

loans.name: Cristobal Rafael

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal República Del Ecuador se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive el señor Cristóbal, tiene 46 años de edad, está soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres. El está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos él y muchos en el grupo salen adelante.

Don Cristobal desde hace muchos años atrás empezó a trabajar en un taller de metalmecánica, allí aprendió todo lo que es arreglo de carrocerías y pintura de vehículos de toda clase, profesión que luego le sirvió para poner su propio taller que es en lo que se desempeña actualmente, el realizar los trabajos a domicilio si así lo quieren sus clientes o en su taller, para él lo importante es trabajar y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, ya que esta es la base para que sus clientes lo recomienden o regresen por el buen servicio que presta, lleva más de 30 años dedicado a esta actividad la cual le sirve para salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus padres.

Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar soldaduras, pinturas y planchas de metal para su trabajo. 

Su sueño es tener un taller con más tecnología.
texts.en:
The República Del Ecuador Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year-round. It is also known for being a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.
Cristóbal lives in this area. He is 46, single, and lives in his parents' home. He has been part of the Communal Bank from the beginning, and he likes it because, thanks to the loans, he and many other members are getting ahead.
Several years ago, Cristobal started working at a mechanic shop. There he learned all about repairing bodywork and paint for all kinds of vehicles. This knowledge served him in later opening his own workshop, where he currently works. He does the work at his clients' homes if they request it, or in his workshop. For him, the important thing is to work and provide good customer service. This will mean that his clients will recommend his business or return because of his good service. He has had this business for over thirty years, and it allows him to get ahead and support his parents.
He will use this loan to buy welding items, paint, and metal planks for his work.
His dream is to have more technology in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy welding items, paint, and metal planks.

loans.name: Nicomedes

texts.es: Don Nicomedes tiene 69 años de edad, es soltero, tiene tres hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura. Hace 6 años decidió por establecer su propio negocio donde vende  ropa de niño, caballeros y damas, calzado, lociones, cosméticos, accesorios etc. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y le ha invertido varios préstamos, lleva cuatro ciclos con el actual que es por L.20,000, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. El espera tener más surtido su negocio para ofrecer variedad de productos y poder salir adelante.
texts.en: Nicomedes is 69 years old, single, has three children, and lives in a small village in the Arizona municipality, in Atlantida. Before, he was a farmer. Six years ago, he decided to start his own business, selling clothes for children, men, and women, as well as shoes, lotions, cosmetics, accessories, etc. He has his store in his home and has invested several loans in it. He has been through four loan cycles. With the current one, which is for L. 20,000, he will invest in the purchase of clothes for women, men, and children. He hopes to have more inventory to offer a variety of products and be able to move forward.

loans.use: purchase clothes for women, men, and children, to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a hardworking mother who helps her husband in generating income for the welfare of her family. She is 49 years old and has three children. She manages their motorcycle transport business while her husband cultivates their farm to get a yield twice a year. 

For the maintenance of their motorcycle, she is asking for a loan of PHP5,000 to buy wheels, sprockets, bearings, gasoline and other accessories needed for their motor vehicle maintenance. She is hoping that her loan will be granted in order for her to continuously use their motorcycle transport business to generate a daily income. She believes that someday, with patience and hard work, their standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: to buy wheels, sprockets, bearings, gasoline and other accessories needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a widowed mother with two children. She is 41 years old and lives in in Mwingi, Kenya. She has been running a grocery shop for the past nineteen years with a monthly income of about KES 14,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Regina is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after she was introduced by an existing KADET client. She will use the loan to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, onions and cabbages in bulk for her grocery store. She will plow back the proceeds into the business. 

She hopes to educate her children to college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, onions and cabbages in bulk.

loans.name: Ninoska De Jesus

texts.es: La joven Ninoska tiene 31 años de edad, es casada madre de un hijo, ella estudia la carrera de Administración de Empresas, no trabaja su esposo le ayuda a pagar los gastos de universidad. Ninoska solicita el apoyo de crédito para poder comprar una computadora, ya que tiene mucha necesidad de adquirir el equipo para poder hacer los trabajos de proyectos que le dan en la universidad, lo que le permitirá desarrollarse más en su profesión, y una vez culminada su carrera buscar empleo para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Young Ninoska is 31 years old, married, and the mother of one son. She studies business administration. She does not work. Her husband helps her pay for college expenses. Ninoska is requesting a loan to be able to purchase a computer because really needs one to work on the projects she is given at the university, which will help her develop and grow more in her career. Once she graduates, she will look for work to support her family.

loans.use: purchase a computer.

loans.name: Ruthchel

texts.en:
Ruthchel is from Militar, Tukuran. She is 28 years old and married. To make a living, she manages a fish vending business, while her husband does the fishing. She has been in her business for more than three years and earns about 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ruthchel joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP recently, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, like fishing nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, like fishing nets.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal República Del Ecuador se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Emperatriz, tiene 48  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad que aun viven en su casa. El marido es maestro constructor. 

Doña Emperatriz es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta en los ratos libres, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días dependiendo de cómo deseen sus clientes. Lleva más de 10  años dedicada  a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The República Del Ecuador Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year-round, as well as for being a city of incomparable beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Emperatriz lives.  She is 48 years old and she is in a civil union which has produced four grown children who live at home.  Her partner is a master builder.

Emperatriz is a homemaker who sells clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies' accessories) to make her own income and to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells door-to-door in her free time and she leaves her products on credit, collecting every eight or fifteen days depending on her customers' preferences.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy clothing, perfume, creams, and cosmetics.  This is her fourth cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are quick and they help her a lot. 

Her dream is to continue with this.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from selling fish.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: Angelinah

texts.en:
Angelinah runs a nursery school in Mombasa county in Kenya. She has been providing education for nine years now and she has employed fifteen people, including teachers. She has taken loans previously from Milango, which she paid back without any challenges. She knew about Milango through a friend and now seeks a loan to create more classes. She has great ambitions of opening a high school in the future. 

The challenge that she faces is some parents' delay in paying school fees. This has an impact on her business. She is also married and blessed with two children who attend school. The income that she raises will improve the living standards of her family and will enable her to help the community.

loans.use: to create more classes.

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja is 47 years old and from the small village of Martvili district. He lives with his brother and mother. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Elguja is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two milking cows and a buffalo. Besides that, he has a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where 200 nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. 

As the existing income is not enough for the family, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Elguja applied for credit at MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. With a loan of 4500 GEL (Georgia lari), Elguja will build a greenhouse. As soon as the greenhouse is built, he will grow mushrooms for selling. 

This credit will be a great support for the family. Elguja is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and grow mushrooms.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, a 29-year-old single mother of one from Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a retail shop. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her shop in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. She also offers money transfer services on the side to supplement her income. 

Christine is requesting a loan from KADET LTD in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour. With the additional income she will earn, she will invest in a future salon business. She plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a large wholesale store and to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline lives in Alta Tiera, Tiguma, Pagadian with her family. She is 48 years old with two children. To make a living, she owns and manages a store selling a variety of home use products in the community. She has been doing this for many years in order to uplift their living situation. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she had joined recently, to buy canned goods, sugar and noodles for resale. She planned to expand her business to generate additional income for the future of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sugar and noodles for resale.

loans.name: Diana Marisol

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal República Del Ecuador se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Diana,  tiene 29 años de edad, está separada y de esa relación tiene un hijo de cuatro  años que estudia en jardín de infantes. Ella vive en casa de los padres

Doña Diana trabaja en un almacén de la ciudad y también se dedica a la comercio, vende productos por catálogos de Avon y Lebel (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a recorrer en sus ratos libres y también vende en el lugar donde trabaja, deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra por semana o quincenas de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes. Así ella se gana el sustento diario ya que tiene bastantes gastos porque que su bebé está enfermo y tiene que estar gastando en médicos y medicinas con mucha frecuencia. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y otros créditos que ofrece la institución. 

Su sueño es que su bebé este bien de salud.
texts.en:
The República Del Ecuador Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round, as well as for being a city of incomparable beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Diana lives.  She is 29 years old, divorced, and she has a four-year-old son who is in kindergarden.  She lives with her parents.

Diana works at a warehouse in the city and she also works in retail, selling Avon and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories) via catalog.  She goes out to sell in her free time and she also sells at work.  She sells her products on credit and she charges every week or every 15 days depending on her customers' preferences.  This is how she earns her daily living as she has many expenses because her baby is sick and she has to pay for doctor visits and medicines very often.   

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams.  She is a founder of the communal bank and she likes it because of the benefits and loans the institution offers. 

Her dream is for her child to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she earns more income from farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell through her buy-and-sell fish business. Minerva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.en:
Oswaldo is 38 years old and married to Najjemba. He has six children and an orphan who lost his parents three years ago. Oswaldo is an agriculturalist who majors in coffee growing and owns about 4 acres of coffee plantations in his region.
 
From the income realized from coffee sales, he has managed to look after his family and, importantly, has constructed a permanent house for his family. However, Oswaldo’s biggest challenge is inadequate income to pay school fees for his children and at the same time re-invest in his business.

He is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy a motorcycle to be used as a boda-boda (transport service) to enable him to mobilize more money for his children who attend formal education.

His dream is to see all his children study up to the university level. He is a hardworking and resilient man.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase farming supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a 50-year-old married mother of five from Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a retail shop. She has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to the lack of investment capital. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her shop in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. 

She is requesting a loan from KADET LTD in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.  With the additional income she will earn from this expansion, she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family and support the education of her five children. 

In the future, Josephine plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a large wholesale store and be able to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, a 25-year-old single businessman in Mwingi, runs a business selling cereals and other grains. He currently lacks the capital needed to purchase items in bulk to restock his store.

With a loan through KADET LTD, Patrick will be able to purchase items in bulk such as beans, maize, sorghum, green grams, cow peas, etc. Patrick is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, having been introduced recently by one of the KADET staff. Additional income created will allow him to reinvest in his business. 

In the future, Patrick would like to get married, have children and be able to sustain his family.

loans.use: to purchase items in bulk, such as beans, maize, sorghum, green grams and cow peas.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 51 years old and married with 5 children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 28 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Elma is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en: Aliya lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 3 children. Her husband owns an artificial jewelry shop which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase a variety of jewelry for the shop that includes bangles, necklaces, rings and bracelets. Therefore, Aliya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase artificial jewelry for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of jewelry for the shop that includes bangles, necklaces, rings and bracelets.

loans.name: Annita

texts.en:
Annita is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a retail shop at Wote market in Makueni town. She also has a boutique business. She has been in this business for 9 years and currently makes a monthly income of about 6,200 Kenya Shillings. 

This is her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to buy cereals, bread, tea leaves, basins and clothes for the boutique business. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Annita hopes to expand her business and be able to provide the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her business.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa is 45 years old, married, and lives in Balangasan, Pagadian. Her husband is a fish vendor and she is selling bagoong (salted fish) in town to earn a living. To conquer poverty, she has been in this line of business since they got married. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy more homemade bagoong to sell. She hopes to open a general store in town to gain more income for their future needs.

loans.use: to buy more homemade bagoong to sell.

loans.name: Gerilyn

texts.en:
Gerilyn aims to improve her variety store to increase her income; that is why she is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 and will buy additional stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, beverages, vegetables and frozen foods to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted to further improve her operation of the business.

She is 32 years old and has three school-age children. Together with her husband, they aim to improve their status of living to give education to their children and uplift their living status. Despite the problems and difficulties that her family encountered in life, still they have the determination to achieve all their goals in life someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, beverages, vegetables and frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Norbel

texts.en: Norbel, 29 years of age, is married and they have been blessed with a child. They are harmoniously residing at the village of Mabantad. Norbel has been into selling used clothes in their village for almost 3 years, and with this she's earning a net income of about Php 500 weekly. Due to financial constraints she decided to ask for a loan amounting to Php 12,000 to purchase used clothes to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to expand her business more to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an oven, bales of flour and a sack of sugar.
